title: The most friendly experience in Singapore
desc: The staff at this hotel is outstanding. Very friendly , helpful and they always have a tip where to go and what do do. Either reception , bakery or concierge â€¦. Always a smile on their faces. Would love to go there again

title: Excellent Location. Nice View. Slightly expensive.
desc: - Excellent Location, next to MRT, next to supermarkets, walking distance to Chinatown - Room is spacious, clean, great view. Great amenities - Expensive no doubt (applies to most hotels in SG) Highly recommend it.... (to those who can afford).

title: Great hotel!
desc: Luxury accommodation, fantastic hotel with 5 star facilities. Staff very friendly and welcoming, conveniently located although singapore isn't the biggest place to get around. Didn't eat at the hotel as there is plenty of fantastic food at local hawker places (go and explore).

title: Average experience
desc: Heard from friends that it's a new hotel, so wanted to try the experience and made a reservation for a night. The front desk officer made a mistake by checking me in a room that is not under my name. Apparently, another guest checking in has the same name as me. But it was okay until the services we requested are just disappointing and not taken professionally. Even the hotel superiors. Staffs need to make improvements. Overall, hotel room is good and pleasant.

title: Fantastic and will definitely come back!
desc: Carlton City is a modern and functional hotel. Check-in was easy and the staff were polite. The rooms are very well appointed, big windows are offered to experience the Singapore skyline and the room had a very clean and new feel to it. The bathrooms as well were modern and well set out. The hotel is very close to an MRT station, extremely convenient. Breakfast was a little ordinary without much of a broad selection and wifi speeds varied from excellent to poor, overall however I would definitely come back!

title: Nice stay. Well located.
desc: We stayed for a week. Nice layout. We paid extra for the executive club which was a good way to have breakfast and drinks and snacks in the evening (although the promised "cocktails" were just a spirit and mixer). There are 3 MRT stations located very close by, Chijmes is across the road and Raffles is next door. The pool was nice and clean. The staff were all very friendly. I would return here.

title: Good hotel to stay
desc: Good rooms and a good hotel to stay. Has a good buffet option to eat. They are placed very close to tanjong pagar road and has quiet a good eat out places around. Had an amazing stay with them and would look forward to further stay.

title: Pricey New Hotel
desc: The hotel was right in the middle of the city. There is an MRT station just 2 minutes walk away, Tangjong Pagar. There are a number of restaurants and bars within walking distance. Location wise, its fantastic. The hotel seemed very new, which the lobby and decor reflected this point. Staff were friendly and the porter was on hand to take care of all the luggage. Check in office were friendly and were able to sort out a slightly difficult accounting issue with ease. The room looked very clean and was quite big. A good view of the surrounding area. However during the stay I did encounter I may have had an issue to the carpeted floor. It did look clean, however I believe it was triggering my allergies to dust, and during my stay I did have some difficulties with my asthma. The

title: Great hotel.
desc: My husband and i stsyed here last August 2015 and loved our stay. Beautiful room, air con, views, lovely bathroom Breakfast was superb every morning, very polite staff and we always had a table even when busy. The area is great, walking distance to china town, water and lots of shops. Supermarket and shops all around hotel. Very enjoyable stay and a beautiful pool too. See you again soon.

title: Disappointing stay (dirty room)
desc: It was my 2nd time to stay at Carlton City and I returned to this hotel because of the pleasant experience in my 1st stay. It appears that the hotel failed to maintain its high standard after opening slightly more than a year. Check-in: Efficient and the staff was friendly. I booked 2 rooms for the family trip and the rooms were on different floors because one is smoking and another one is non-smoking, which was absolutely reasonable and understandable. One improvement in this area is that we should be given 3 keys so that we could go to two rooms easily. I did ask for this arrangement but was refused. Room: Just opened slightly over a year and I could see moulds on the wall and celling. In addition, quite a few things were covered with a thick layer of dusts and it was

title: Amazing location
desc: We were up-graded on arrival, which was amazing and most welcome. Everything we wanted to visit was in walking distance or easily accessible via MRT with the station right next to the hotel. Loved it. Last time we stayed at the Marina Bay Mandarin and we're happy with that, but this stay was far better and also the location more convenient.

title: Nice hotel, close to Central Business district
desc: I enjoyed this hotel as it was easy walking distance to my office. The breakfast in the morning was quite good, and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful whenever I had a question. I would stay here again the next time I'm in Singapore.

title: Excellent hotel
desc: Loved this hotel! Beautiful rooms & reception. Friendly staff. Good location easy enough to get to main attractions. We stayed here for 3 days as part of a 2 week Asia trip. We are going back here again in April 2016 for a few days as we lived Singapore and this hotel is great value for money :)

title: Great for Tourists and Businessmen!
desc: Took a staycation package for a night, and we took it because it was affordable for the brand. Its a new hotel too so we're curious to check it out. For tourists & businessmen, this is a great hotel, location is good as it is within the CBD, near the MRT station, and accessible to great shopping, tour and food places, as well to officers and convention centres. Room and its amenities are great, still fresh being a new hotel, and being within the CBD means the views are mostly of neighbouring skyscrapers. Service is good too, and staff have been friendly and helpful. Restaurant is normal, but the pricing is good. For the price I paid, I am very satisfied.

title: Good experience!
desc: Was happy about the stay and the service. Stayed here for a week. Food was okay but being a vegetarian I didn't think there were enough options. The room was a decent size with requisite amenities. Overall it was a nice place. Food is the only thing I was not entirely happy about.

title: Unexpected delight!
desc: We stayed at The Carlton City on the 27th floor for 3 nights. The room was luxurious, the design was terrify and the view from our large window seat was splendid, looking over the city. Free cocktails in the restricted cocktail lounge were included. The hor- d'oefs were fresh and tasty, the staff couldn't have been more pleasant. Easy walking distance or short cab ride to most of the 'sights'.We're looking forward to a return visit sometime.

title: Great Location
desc: Well located on the fringe of Chinatown,close to MRT with good access not only to Changi Airport but all that Singapore has to offer. Rooms are great, spacious with fantastic bathroom.Lovely pool area.

title: New, clean and well located
desc: Nice new hotel, close to Chinatown and many businesses. Rooms are relatively spacious, light (big windows) with well-functioning air conditioning. Good bathroom amenities, friendly staff. The hotel is next to Tanjong Pagar metro, which allows for easy access to many parts of Singapore. There is a 24/7 supermarket next door. The gym should be much bigger, and the pool area should be closed off from the restaurant.

title: Very comfortable stay
desc: We arrives to Singapore for a short vacation with our 2 year old. On arrival, we were provided with the room without a delay, and the room was everything we hoped for... very comfortable bed, bathroom was perfect. We stayed at the hotel only at nights and there were no disturbances. We ordered in room dining when we came back to the hotel for all 3 days and, service was excellent. Order came in twenty minutes and tasty. It was a relief to have such a wonderful resting place after sightseeing. We will always come back!!!

title: New Year Eve Dinner
desc: We chose Carlton City for the New Year Eve Dinner 2016. The dinner was perfect: seafood (lobsters, chilli crab, black-paper crab, oysters, prawns..), western Christmas-style food, deserts , tea, coffee, wine. Pleasant atmosphere. Not crowded. Price was very attractive 78$ pp for dinner, child below 7- for free. I will definitely go there next time. I should mention that we did not stay in this hotel, we were there only for dinner.

title: Great hotel, good location and helpful staff
desc: Located just across from Chinatown and the 100am shopping mall, in Tanjong Pagar area, you are just 10 minutes walk to the metro system and have most of what you need in terms of food, shops, great supermarket with Japanese goodies and an excellent bakery (Imperial Treasure, some of the best I have ever tasted). Breakfast in the hotel is too pricey (30 Sing dollar per person per day) so the next door "Treasure"is great. Or you can start your day with some tasty gioza from the Gioza King which is 5 minutes walk. Gym is very smal and pool a bit cold but both usable

title: Brilliant!
desc: Very good room and fast check in ...helpfull front desk staff but the the service at the photocopy and fax was terrible..lack of understanding and not listening to what guest says end up rinting out so many color copys and evantually had to complain when the guy say we have to pay for the color eventhough we made sure he understand english that we say we need B&W Copy! Room is great,good choice for breakfast,close to the singapore metro networ and shopping district...not so far from the Sands Hotel and all other major attractions!

title: Everything is great
desc: Hotel room is cozy, nice bathroom with bath tub and shower. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Check in and check out were quick. Great facilities, i.e. swimming pool with whirlpool at the corner and gym. Location is great, only few minutes walk from MRT station.

title: Strategic Locations and convenient public transport
desc: I had the opportunity to stay at the new Carlton City Hotel, Tanjong Pagar last December 2015. Went there with family for holiday and very pleased with the room we booked. We arrived at Singapore at 2 am because of flight delayed. It didn't take long to reach the hotel as distances were not the matter in a city like Singapore. We checked in at Carlton City hotel around 2.15 am but the process took quite some time, which became our concern since it was already past midnight. IMO, the receptionist should make it simpler and faster (she kept explaining about payments which kinda hard to understand at 3 in the morning). But the room is nice and clean, and just avout the right size for deluxe type (unfortunately I forgot to take picture), with bathtub. The hotel's design was sleek

title: I will come back next time
desc: Nice environment, clean and bright. Good location - near MRT, and there are a lot of food choices nearby, both higher end and lower end. We didn't try the hotel restaurant though. Spacious room, also there are bath tub as well as shower area in the bathroom.

title: Good hotel, good location
desc: Good standard hotel. Liked the rooms and the harbour view that I got on my 15th floor room. Liked the elaborate breakfast for both vegetarian and non - vegetarian varieties. There is a bar on the top floor and the view from there is better. But, the food menu at the bar can be improved. The hotel is located 10mins walking distance to China town.

title: Well located and excellent service
desc: It is a two blocks of a subway station and at a walking distance to Chinatown. There are several restaurant nearby and a market in from of it. Staff is very kind, breakfast buffet is good enough and rooms are clean and well furnitured.

title: restaurant manager needs training
desc: Manager was not professional in handling customers who came to make payment at Plate for a New Year Eve buffet booking. When requested to be given or arranged for seats for the dining day, we were told three times that they restaurant can not be responsible for any outcome for the request despite the fact that customers merely requested to be seated in a cluster of 4. He insisted that this is the way hotel works. Is there no alternative way of assuring customers that the hotel/restaurant will do their best. Hotel staff should know how to communicate in a professional and warm way. This will value-add the hotel. Customers have paid in advanced without having been served a glass of water, how can the staff respond in such a defensive manner.

title: High standard and excellent value
desc: We stayed here for two nights in December after booking last minute via booking.com and getting a very good deal. Check-in was good and despite arriving at 09:30, the receptionist was able to offer us our room straight away. The room was stunning and the entire hotel was absolutely gleaming. We thoroughly enjoyed the wide range of food on offer at breakfast. All the staff were very helpful and polite. We visited the skybar - what a view! Excellent location, a short walk to the nearest MRT station. Highly recommended.

title: Disappointment
desc: My two Grandchildren and I booked 3 nights at the Carlton City Hotel, after returning from a Cruise. This covered the New Year period. To make it even more special we booked Club Lounge facilities also. So my Grandchildren shared one double room, and I the other. After booking in we realised staff had actually booked the two rooms under my Grandchildren's names, one of which was 13 years old. My Grandchildren after booking into their room, were surprised not only once, but twice with other guests being given their room keys, obviously this caused much embarrassment to all concerned. The Hotel Staff did offer apologies and a small box of Chocolates. The greatest disappointment for me was the Club Lounge, and what it had to offer in the way of food. I am Gluten intolerant and

title: Clean Hotel with a Strategic Location
desc: The hotel is very new and modern, hence the rooms has a modern city vibe to it. The room which we stayed in was clean, but the linens were slightly stained. The water pressure at the bathroom's sink was too low and the water temperature in the shower was erratic. Overall, it was a decent stay with room for improvement. Its location is very strategic, being very close to Chinatown and not too far from Marina Bay and Orchard Road.

title: Great place for a sightseeing trip!!
desc: We have stayed for 4 nights and we found it was a good place if you are in the city for sightseeing. Chinatown is only a fiftheen minutes walk away and it takes about 30 minutes to the marina bay hotel. There are also a couple of nice restaurants and hawker centres in walking distance. The room was spacy for a city hotel and it was very clean.

title: Terrific Other Than Device Charging Challenges and Maybe the Food
desc: Our cruise ended in Singapore early on a Sunday morning, and this was our home for the next 4 days. We knew our room wouldn't be available until at least noon, so we waited in the lobby bar/lounge area with coffee and soda. Our server was hospitable, charming and helpful. We wanted to go to brunch in the hotel but we're astonished to be refused; it was full. No waiting, it was full and that was it. We didn't think that was handled very well. But from then on, we thought the service was excellent. Being techies, we had phones and tablets that we wanted to charge. U.S. 110 plugs are not compatible with Singapore's 220 electricity and we found out the hard way when the converter they brought us only led to our blowing out the multi-plug device we'd brought. They brought us a

title: Hubby working- Wife holidays ðŸ˜‰
desc: Loved the hotel that I thought was in a great location for a home base. Service was fantastic. Unfortunately drinks at the Upstairs Bar and laundry were ridiculously priced. Would not opt for the breakfast deal again as I found it very disappointing. However I would definitely stay there again rooms, service and location (right near train station too) was great.

title: No much review about this hotel.. Just Excellent !!
desc: Stay here for work about 4 nights. The hotel is quite brand new, the room is very clean, the cleaning service done a good job every day. The location is very strategic, near tanjong pagar mrt station, only 5 min walking distance, near the hotel there are lots of food choices. Beside the hotel there are small mall called 100m or m100 (I mixed up), offer some good restaurant and there also dept store ( fair price finest) so you can buy your snacks and drinks. The breakfast also good, many variety like others hotel do. Until now I haven't find a flaw yet in this hotel. Since this is business district hotel, it offer great price for weekend tourist and family travel. I surely come to stay again in this hotel next visit in January 2016.

title: decent rates, good sized rooms, great business hotel close to city
desc: I spent a week here in December, I've been to Singapore many times and happened to live pretty much next door to this place when it was being built a couple of years ago. Fast forward, living elsewhere but get back to Singapore every now and then and looking for a decent hotel close to the city I found this one with very good rates. The location is excellent, close to downtown - one mrt stop to raffles place/boat quay and I often walk it when it's not so hot, close to chinatown and club street and with good local facilities in mall next door. Staff were excellent and fixed my local sim card, Pool is fine, as is gym. I didn't have breakfast or any food there as too much other interesting food nearby including the hawker stalls so cannot comment on that. I'll be back.

title: Very good service in central location
desc: Hotel located very close to the Tanjung Pagar MRT station and the same distance to Chinatown. Perfect location for exploring the city. We really enjoyed out stay at the hotel. Very good service and standard. The brakfast was excellent!

title: Great Service
desc: We stayed for 5 nights in a club room and will definitely stay again, the staff were fantastic, the hotel was clean and modern and the location was ideal for Chinatown or even a walk to Clarke Quay (though there is a close by MRT station if you don't want to walk) Loved the sky bar. The food was very good though a bit limited in choice. Only possible complaints were that the breakfast choice was limited and there is only a tiny fridge in the room so it is not really possible to chill your own drinks, which with a stand bottle of wine at the hotel being very expensive is a shame.

title: lovely rooms , great hotel, great 4 star, know taxi's no this hotel
desc: The reception were very helpful in answering our question when we first arrived, however they were unsure about the times that the liquid buffet was open so they were going to get back to us about it but we did not hear anything back. The room was amazing with very comfortable bed just what you would except of a top quality hotel, but the draw above the fridge was always hot because of the fridge underneath which was very small and had no freezer section. The TV would turn back to the menu after watching it for 10 minutes and you could watch no longer than that so you have to watch a film in 10 minute sections. The wifi was very good and easy to access, also the light switches by the beds were a bit confusing. The facilities were very good, the pool was nice a bit cold do that

title: Liar
desc: Stayed 3 nights with my parents in this hotel during the Christmas. When I was checking-in at the reception the friendly staff, namely Kristen, told me that breakfast would be offered. I knew my booking did not include breakfast so I got back to her and she reassured me that the breakfast would be free. Sadly, when we arrived the restaurant next day morning, the restaurant staff said we were not entitled for complimentary breakfast. We waited over 10 minutes for them to check with the reservation and they gave us the same answer. It was quite embarrassed but we had no choice but leaving the restaurant. Unfortunately I was unable to see Kristen again and to clarify everything. Hotel breakfast was not essential to us as we had great breakfast somewhere else. But I do feel

title: Not Worth The Money
desc: We stayed at Carlton City Hotel on 25 Dec 2015, which was a Christmas staycation. The package included frills related to Christmas, like wine, goodies and free breakfast. We were given a good room, at 25th storey, which gave us a good view of the SG port, facing Sentosa/Pulau Brani. The room was spacious, and the design was contemporary. The bed was also comfortable and the toilet facilities were clean; the hot water was good, with a knob to control the temperature and a separate one to control water (unlike typical hotel settings which require users to tweak and toggle hot and cold water taps simultaneously). The pool was not big, but at 25m, it was comparable to other hotels. There were 2 other families and a solo swimmer. There was a heated pool (I think it's Jacuzzi, I did

title: Excellent location and comfortable, cosy rooms
desc: We stayed over the Christmas period for a couple of days, and we loved this hotel. It is located between Chinatown and Marina Bay area, so there are both options to either have a nice walk around or use the multiple transport connections close by. Size of the rooms does vary in Singapore, so we loved the great room size and ambience of the hotel. The hotel offers modern, large-size bathrooms with rainshower and bathtub, and excellent large beds with comfortable pillows (fitted with a posturepedic mattress according to the advertising sign) but we did enjoy a great sleeping quality so we give them great stars for this extra care. In terms of service, the front counter staff were always helpful and very professional, while at the same time they very approachable and friendly.

title: Nice hotel
desc: It was a short stay so I can't tell much but good location in city center to reach to Clark Quay, Marina bay. Clean and nice room and it was very spacious. I assume that total value for money would be very high since it has good swimming pool.

title: Christmas vacation stay
desc: First time to this hotel just to celebrate Xmas with family. The room was spacious, big enough for 2 adults & 2 kids. We requested for twin beds. The bathroom comes with a bathtub, seperate shower area just like what the website pictures were featured. The hotel is just next to the Tanjong Pagar Mrt which adds the convenience to get to everywhere. Opposite the hotel has a very good & cheap hawker centre, plus a ntuc supermarket. As we checked in on Xmas Eve, guests were given a welcome packed Xmas cookies as a gift from Carlton City. The sky lounge has a splendid view. The only downside was the pool was very small just outside the Plate restaurant. Definitely will recommend others to stay here even for a short getaway.

title: Excellent as always
desc: Returned to this hotel for a short staycation on Xmas Eve. Carlton City Hotel is as always - excellent, clean, and modern with a touch of classiness. It was great to meet Augustine again, who was one of the executive managerial staff over there. Thanks for your help, Augustine.

title: Had an Amazing Stay!
desc: It was such a great experience!Had a staycation here.Room was clean and well maintained.Everything was working,front desk was so friendly and helpful:) The view from the room was good.Had many Japanese restaurants and food places nearby.Nearby the Tanjong Pagar MRT, the city.Will stay there again if given the opportunity!

title: Excellent stay
desc: We stayed for one night for a get away and celebrate our anniversary, later that day some heart warming gift and card sent to our room. It's always the small thing that matter. I'm ready to go back to carlton city soon..thank you so much for the great experience :D (especially in this busy holiday season.)

title: Great birthday staycation!
desc: My boyfriend and I love this hotel! It offers one of the best quality rooms for a very reasonable price. We've stayed here on both our birthdays and both times we were equally impressed. The layout of the room is excellent - you've ample space to move around, huge comfortable bed, and the toilet has an awesome rain shower and separate bath. The only thing that mildly annoyed me was that their check-in's are usually delayed so try to come later (2-3pm). Otherwise, you'll have to sit at the reception area (for close to an hour) and wait while your room is prepared. Good service recovery though - we were given a late checkout (i.e. 3pm). There is an entire row of awesome restaurants within 2-5 minute walking distance so you don't have to go far for excellent food. There is also

title: Will come back again!
desc: I've stayed at a few business hotels in Singapore, but I think Carlton City is by far the best one to date! It's a 2 minute walk to my office, so very hard to beat when it comes to convenience. There are lots of places to eat around the hotel, so even when we checked in at 9:30pm, we were able to still grab a bit to eat around the corner. The rooms are quite spacious.....with a full size bathroom! I had a great stay overall....the only small annoyance I faced was that the line to breakfast buffet felt a little backwards. There was only one person at the front who led and seated people so I often found myself waiting 5-7 minutes to get into the dining room....which isnt very efficient when I had morning meetings to get to.

title: Excellent from all points of view
desc: Excellent position, excellent service, excellent room. Breakfast was good, maybe a bit expensive. Last but not least, the bar on the toproof floor has a wonderful view with very good dishes and not-so-cheap but more than reasonable prices.

title: Staying in Singapore? Give this a whirl !!
desc: Yup....I can be fussy and spend my money carefully. I want value and when I get it, I say so. Well done the Carlton City Hotel. Not the first time I have stayed there but standards are so consistently good, staff excellent and the most comfortable and clean rooms you will ever find. Check in out is quick and efficient. The new shopping mall / food court across the road is great, as is the supermarket and ATM facility opposite. You can't go wrong staying here. Right on the edge of Chinatown with great shopping etc.

title: Nice place to stay
desc: The hotel are good, room are comfortable although its a little bit small.. Pool qnd gym are very small..The environtment is ok.. Easy to find food in surrounding area.. Near to maxwell food court .. You can find the famous tian tian chicken rice there and just in front of the hotel there is tanjong pagar food market also..the area is quite far from orchard although there is mrt station nearby.. But if you want to do shopping at the orchard maybe it will not convenience to bring all the stuff that you buy along the way and you can't easily drop it to the hotel

title: A local experience
desc: Great hotel in the heart of the Financial District. A must do if you prefer to experience the local scene rather than being surround by tourists. Good facilities and central to China town and clubs (straight & gay). Rooms are clean and beds reasonably comfortable.

title: Great hotel
desc: Great hotel in prime location for the metro to the airport, Chinatown, food courts, and night life.... Small functional lobby, terrible check in but I'd stay here again... The pool is smallish but good and the gym is very small. You can easily run to the marina for a nice workout

title: A lovely stay
desc: Overall a lovely stay. The room is clean and well made. Love the comfortable bed. Staff are friendly. Issues are the basin tap and WIFI are not working 100% (connected but can't surf, Staff said due to too many users)

title: fridge and front door
desc: Initially thought the room was all good, until i returned from dinner, I realised the fridge has unpleasant smell. Despite they were kind enough to exchange the fridge immediately, the new fridge doesn't work at all. So the comments here were correct. I have requested to have a room change and it seems I had to wait in the room for a good while to get a feedback .... I am not sure if I would want to stay here again ....

title: Short stay
desc: Very nice hotel, clean great staff nice views of the city... rooms are great! The location is awsome and everything in singapore is only a short taxi ride away (if not a short walk) There is nothing I could fault with the accomidation.

title: well located, very nice and clean
desc: very nice and clean, the choice of color combination with class, its cozy, huge window, huge bathroom with tub, very good water supply,the bed is comfortable, the place have a lot of 24/7 stores next door. and also plenty of bars around the place. classy hotel

title: excellent hotel
desc: large rooms well equipted , quiet. very full breakfast .Well located ( 150m of sub station). Very professional and attentive staff . beautiful swimming pool, nice bar on the top floor with terrace, so good to have a drink.

title: Good hotel in convenient location
desc: We loved this hotel - the room was spacious with an excellent bathroom with rainshower and the bath looking through a big window (with blind) to the bedroom. Plentiful towels and very fluffy. We were exhausted from departing a cruise so spent most of the day at the pool. Great pool, just right water level and a set of stairs for seniors to enter the pool safely instead of a ladder. Unfortunately we only stayed the day and night and left early for the airport, so can't comment on the breakfast but we were more than happy there. MRT is a couple of minutes across the street and as usual was fast and efficient.

title: Quality Hotel, Cool Neighborhood
desc: The Carlton City is a nice, modern hotel. The price seemed low for the quality of amenities. There is a small rooftop bar that is worth checking out: the view is good. The neighborhood, Tanjong Pagar, is bustling with many Asian and Western eateries, not to mention some local favorites too like Maxwell Food Centre with its famous chicken rice. Carlton City is also fairly close to the CBD: I was here for work and to visit friends, and I was able to walk to work on Shenton Way every day. I would stay here again.

title: Friendly Service stylish
desc: Rooms are clean and spacious. The Roms got a shower and a bath tube. All lights switches are nearby to the bed that it Fouls be easily turned off. Hotel got a small roof top bar with a harbour view (Cargo). Prices are ruther high. All staff is very friendly and helpful

title: Great Rooms but thats all
desc: I have seen this hotel many time but never stayed so I decided to try it. The hotel itself is lovely, the reception is nice and the rooms are great but thatâ€™s where it stops. The water pressure at the taps is very low, I was on the 24th floor, the club lounge like the rest of the hotel is big and look great with a nice balcony overlooking the sea, however the food is rubbish, the selection poor and the service average. The main restaurant is ok but the food selection again was very poor, I actually donâ€™t even think the bread was fresh and the lettuce leaves were going brown. Housekeeping is a joke, I had to keep ringing reception to get them to translate for me because housekeeping did not understand English. Also on two days they forgot to collect the laundry. I'll not be

title: Very Nice Hotel
desc: Staff were all very friendly and super nice. The hotel itself is very well presented and the facility's are nice. I could not have asked for a nicer room, 17th floor, quiet, clean, spacious and a very comfy bed.

title: Enjoyable stay but expected a little more
desc: Stay at this hotel was enjoyable. It is located convenient and rooms are spacious. However it was a bit of a turn off that there was mould clearly visible in the bathroom - around the bathtub and shower, which was a shame as the bathroom was great in all other ways.

title: Comfort and space
desc: A very good experience in a club room.Staff very friendly and helpful.Rooms very spacious with immensely comfortable beds.Superb bathroom and good quality food and drink for free from 6 to 8 in the evening.

title: Quiet room and great location
desc: We stayed 2 nights before our cruise. We arrived early afternoon and was quickly checked into our room. We never heard any noise from other rooms or the hallway. The room was big enough and clean. The beds and pillows were very comfortably. We chose this hotel because the MRT was around the corner - and easy access to all of Singapore. At the MRT station we found a food court and bakeries that served wonderful breads that we ate for our breakfast. Across the street was a market that we purchased fruit, yogurt and juice that we kept in our fridge. Prior to our visit I contacted the concierge for recommendations of local tours. They emailed me a couple of tours to review. When we arrived the concierge booked the tour for us and arranged pick up for us in the hotel lobby.

title: Club Deal Good Value
desc: Very comfortable room. Bath was very welcome after walking around all day, very relaxing. Enjoyed the Club Deal which included breakfast and drinks/cocktails in the evening. Also included aperitifs which were tasty, and we're sufficient that we didn't need any dinner. Enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the evening, with the balmy nights and city views.

title: 2nd Stay Greatly improved check-in
desc: Second stay at the Carlton City, chosen due to proximity to office. Once again vwey comfortable bed nice clean room. Check-in this time was a breeze pleasant and efficient, previous had some issues but greatly improved my hotel of choice in singapore

title: Best hotel rooms in Singapore
desc: I booked myself an executive room for 3 nights with free wifi, free breakfast and free mini bar. The experience started the moment I entered the huge reception. Check in was done in less than 2 minutes and I was surprised to see a BIG room which is rare in Singapore. With oversized window overlooking skyscrappers, my money was already proved worth it. Bathroom was equally big with separate shower area and bath tub. Room amenities include a 42 inch LED and iron with ironing board. Breakfast was lavish with equal preferences for vegetarians. Gym and swimming pool was big too. Overall a wonderful experience.

title: Go for the club level rooms
desc: We were impressed with this hotel. We enjoyed the club level room that puts you on the top floors, which I like when staying in a hotel. We could see Chinatown from our room, and thought the view was great. We found the location very convenient. About twenty minutes taxi ride from the airport. Plus, you could easily walk to Chinatown, the metro, and several other areas that were close by. There is also a mall right next door with shops and restaurants. We mainly took taxis when we went to other attractions, and most places were within 10 minutes and cost 10 Singapore Dollars or less. The staff was friendly and helpful. Especially in the Carlton Club Lounge. With the club level rooms, you get 2 pieces of free laundry every day, free breakfast, evening cocktails and light

title: Comfortable hotel in a great location
desc: LOCATION: Centrally located in Tanjong Pagar, right next to Tanjong Pagar MRT station. Many coffee shops, restaurants, bakeries and convenience stores close to the hotel. Busy downtown area during the day, very quiet at night. Within walking distance to Tanjong Pagar and Duxton Hill bars and restaurants, aswell as the Maxwell Food Centre and Chinatown. Buses 80 and 145 take you in 10 minutes to Vivo City/Sentosa, aswell as to Chinatown, Clarke Quay and Bugis, if you prefer buses to MRTs. HOTEL: Modern, stylish highrise building. Beautiful lobby, nice gym and a relaxing pool area. Laid back Graffiti Sky Bar on 29th floor with wonderful views of Singapore. Free wifi. ROOM: Great rooms with modern interior, nice bathrooms, which get daylight through a glass window from the room

title: The most convenient hotel with the best value proposition in town
desc: The Carlton City Hotel (not to be confused with the Carlton in Orchid Rd) offers the most convenient locationl with the best value proposition in town. It is walking distance to China town is you are after some food at the hawker centers and right next to Tanjong Pagar MRT station, which is directly connected to the airport and will also get you to any other point in the city center cheaply. The hotel itself is quite new and I find the value for money proposition quite good. It has a nice bar at the rooftop with sunset-drenched views of the port. The A/C blows cold and the gym and pool are a bonus if you want to use them.

title: Housekeeping Needs To Be Better
desc: This is our 3rd stay at this hotel as it's reasonably priced for a hotel in the city next to the MRT station. Rooms are still in good conditions and front desk staffs are polite and friendly. The only complain I have is that housekeeping could be better. There was once after the room was cleaned that I found a towel they replaced to be all torn and tattered (photo posted). It might be a small matter to some, but I find it surprising that the hotel allow towels in that condition to be still circulating around. Hopefully the housekeeping will not get worse the next time I choose to stay back in this hotel.

title: wonderful weekend rest
desc: Needed a weekend rest and got a complimentary upgrade to the room on the higher levels. It was quiet and undisturbed. Love it that i can get my local food fix at the market nearby and there are many eateries/bars within vicinity. Walking is encouraged. 100am was also near where I bought my snacks (NTUC finest) for couch potato activities, especially when this hotel have the FOX movies premium channel, which was superb as I love movies. Room service was also good, they served really delicious hokkien mee.

title: A good hotel with all required amenities
desc: Stayed here with my wife during last February who was in Singapore to attend a training. The location is very convenient since Tanjong Pagar MRT was just 2 minutes walking distance which helped us to roam around the city easily. Moreover, Chinatown was just beside.

title: Business Budget Hotel In Singapore
desc: Cost effective centrally located hotel in Singapore. To me, the position it occupies is somewhere between a motel and a hotel. Rooms were smallish but clean, breakfast at Plate was uninspiring - opt for Tuxedo in the lobby first thing in the day - and the room service food was average. Everything about the place was 'functional' - works fine but no frills.

title: Nice modern hotel with many advantages
desc: + Very nice room, reasonably sized, high ceiling, large window, good view + Comfortable bed, very quiet room, curtains can render the room very dark if you invest a lot of effort pulling it here and there. + Nice looking bathroom. - Amount of water from showerhead and tap leaves much to be desired. If this is a legitimate attempt to conserve water, perhaps I shouldn't criticize it, but I don't have to like it. + They provide an Android smartphone for that you can take with you to enjoy unlimited mobile Internet and phone calls everywhere in the city. Very very nice, but even nicer would be just a SIM card so that I can continue to use my phone and my Whatsapp and my e-mail and my Facebook etc. etc. + Large outdoor swimming pool and suntanning area. + Very good location next to

title: Great hotel and excellent service
desc: After staying at the Amara on previous trips, I thought I'd try the new Carlton City next door, It's a stylish, modern hotel, with excellent facilities in a good location in the southern part of Chinatown near a metro station. What set this stay apart from others is the level of service from the staff. My friend and I arrived around 5PM but our room wasn't ready. The receptionist quickly apologised and gave us access to the Club Lounge while we waited. The lounge offered complimentary drinks and a buffet, which more than made up for the inconvenience. Our room wasn't ready for nearly two hours, by which time we'd enjoyed a few free drinks and plenty of food. To apologise for the long delay, our Club access was extended for our whole stay. This included complimentary

title: Wonderful place to stay
desc: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was finished to a very high standard and everything worked as expected. The Carlton club lounge upgrade was worth every penny - the breakfast was good, as were the evening refreshments. Great value for money and I'll certainly stay here again.

title: Good Stay
desc: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel during the Lunar New Year which was a public holiday. As a result the CBD area was very quiet and no traffic noise could be heard. The room had an overwhelming damp smell in it, other than that it was spacious and clean. The bathroom on the other hand needed more attention. There were thick black women's hair on the floor and the toilet seat was dirty. Room service was great and they were available at any time. The bed was big and comfy. MRT accessibility was great as it is just a 3 min walk from the hotel.

title: A clean, functional business hotel
desc: There's no getting away from the fact that this is primarily a business hotel and has very little soul. However the rooms are a good size and are clean and functional and the hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The negative points for me were the breakfast offering - expensive and uninspiring, and also the fact that the rooms often aren't cleaned/made up until late in the afternoon and in fact on our first day the room wasn't cleaned at all and we had to phone down for fresh towels etc. The bar on the top floor was great, it would be nice if it stayed open a little later though.

title: Reasonably priced for a new modern hotel in a convenient location
desc: This is my first time staying at Carlton City hotel. Initial reaction was that it is a sleek and modern hotel. The rooms were reasonably priced but I am sure I can find international hotels chains with similar pricing. The rooms itself were modern with a sleek decor that feels very comfortable. Most of the items in the room seemed fairly new. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is just literally across the street from a 24hr fair price supermarket. As well within the vicinity, you will find a very local food centre, Maxwell food court, which is very famous for their chicken rice. But be prepared to line up and get there before 7:30pm as they close very early. As well, you will find alot of korean bbq restaurants in the area. A little bit further down

title: Very nice & excellent service
desc: We stayed for 4 nights in a club room from the 10 th to 14 th Feb 2016. The service We received was excellent . I throughly recommend this hotel. I have one small gripe , but that was handled intelligently and sensibly by the hotel staff . I booked via booking . Com . In the uk we use debit cards a lot - I understood I was purchasing a " pay now room " so gave my card details expecting the full balance to be taken . However I kept getting credit card decline messages .. I knew there was nothing wrong with my card . So I then turned to my vacation. Card ( a prepaid US$ MasterCard , that I load up for vacation s )that too was declined! Despite have a balance far in excess of the room rate requirement . I contacted both my bank & card holder that said nothing wrong with cards .

title: Nice neighborhood, nice rooms
desc: Rooms are nice and spacious, huge bathroom with auto blinds. It's singapore, everything is clean and spotless. I even felt it was safe enough to take a nice relaxing bath- and it was just that. There's a supermarket across the street that's open 24hrs and a mall (nothing highend) you can go for shopping at watson's or a pharmacy. Don't expect any breathtaking views though, it's behind other high rise buildings so you won't see the cool landmarksnof singapore from your window.

title: Second visit
desc: I was very happy the first time I stayed here but on my return visit I was very unhappy with my room as it was a disabled room and everything was at a low level .. There wasn't a shower, the toilet seat was filthy and the sink didn't have any hot water .. Also I had emailed the hotel requesting late check out as normal check out is 12 noon and upon arrival to the hotel they said they couldn't accommodate me with late check out as the hotel capacity was full but when I complained about my room all of a sudden I could have late check out at a price but I said I wouldnt be paying a penny as I wasn't happy in the first place .. Other than that the hotel is in a good location and most of the staff are lovely .

title: Great hotel
desc: I stayed at this hotel with family, the hotel is very grand and clean, the employees are very friendly. rooms smell of cigarettes seems like a used previous guests. for the morning breakfast was very tasty and lots of variety, very strategic location which is close to the shopping center and is very easy to look for food. the bellboy was very friendly and very helpful when we needed a taxi to go to the airport. This hotel is my first choice when visiting singapore again.

title: Wonderful Introduction to Singapore
desc: Great room , clean spacious , fabulous views. The staff were great , polite , helpful. The restaurant was good , excellent choices for breakfast, main and snack menus were comprehensive and the food beautifully prepared and tasty. The gym was good. The pool was wonderful . The 29th floor bar was stunning. We had a great 3 days. Excellent location for my husbands business meetings and for my daughter and I to relax.

title: Stylish Hotel with Minor Imperfections
desc: South of the centre of downtown Singapore, this hotel is situated a few hundred yards south of China Town. The lobby and the rooms have a common design, modern and stylish. Room 2218 is neither roomy nor cramped. The room is quiet, no traffic noise can be heard. The aircon is only whispering, but very effective. The bath room showes high-end materials, a nice bath tub and a rain shower. It is a pity that the water pressure is too low as to allow the massage function of the hand shower to be enjoyed. The hair dryer is not to be found in the bath room, it is stored in the closet, which makes sense as there is no suitable power outlet for it in the bath room. The mini bar offered beer and soft drinks which have to be drunken from the can as no jars were available. At least, coffee

title: Good stay
desc: Standing tall at CBD of Singapore this hotel was worth a stay. They are part of world hotels and points accrued during the stay can be used for other world hotel stays as well. MRT station and cab accessibility are pretty easy. MRT is just a 100 meter walk while cabbies are always available round the clock. Accessibility wise as well I would give it full score. They have a sky lounge as well as restaurants in the hotel so no hassle for food drinks n unwinding after long day outing. Room service is quite good n they enter room only when guest step out. If u don't wish to be disturbed they have a privacy switch which is inside the room so no hassle of opening door n hanging boards for your quiet time. They have taken special care of floors not accessible to anyone who is not

title: 1 night staycation
desc: Had a great stay over here. Price is reasonable considering with breakfast throwing in for my deluxe package. The room is spacious, bathroom is big. The bed was comfortable too. Really glad to have a high floor with a good view over the port. Breakfast could be better but overall still ok. Check-in was ok. But, the counter check-in staff could smile more!? Anyway would really like to thank the Indian uncle technician who helped me fix the television when I encountered distorted images. Will definitely go for another 1 night or 2 nights staycation again. Cheers...â˜º

title: Excellent
desc: Free mobile phone with unlimited local and international call and mobile internet. clean and new room. good location with shop and market, MTR, food and restaurant, China Town. reasonable cheap price. Only one thing , the water pressure of the shower is not good enough.

title: Wonderful service
desc: Having stayed there recently we were so happy ,the service ,the staff and the overall accommodation was first class.We would highly recommend it.We ate there and found the meals of excellent quality and reasonably priced.

title: Excellent stay
desc: This hotel is part of the Carlton network, seems aimed at the business traveler but we enjoyed it on holiday. Well located near Chinatown, an easy walk the the local metro and lots of excellent restaurants in the surrounding area. Very stylish and well run, helpful and courteous front desk. Rooms were wonderful, sparkling clean, well serviced. Breakfast buffet was excellent. We'd recommend it, although if you wanted to be closer to the convention center or waterfront there are other Carlton's (and others) better situated. But if you like a little more immersion and riding the local metro (which we do), this hotel is a good choice.

title: Awesome place!
desc: All rooms with king size bed were taken, so to avoid twin beds, we took a handicap room. The room was great, nice and clean. We were warned about the toilet being different and it was! The staff were very helpful. This hotel is in a great location! The pool is not heated, so it was cold, but clean. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Clean, functional, great location, spacious
desc: Stayed here on business for six nights. Great location, spacious, modern room, clean and cleaned well daily. Very friendly and courteous cleaning staff who add a personal touch, which is unusual in these large anonymous hotels. One item that surprised and delighted me was a free smart phone to use during my stay. Yes, of course it is funded by advertising and promotional material, but its simply a great idea. Use it with google maps to get around town, make free local and international calls (a limited list). Never had breakfast in the main hotel dining room, but had something small in the coffee shop on the ground level - super friendly staff, great coffee and really fresh and great food. Nice pool deck, roof top bar, decent gym. Overall a great stay, will be back, if the

title: Great staycation for wedding proposals @ Carlton City Hotel
desc: Booked a deluxe room on Sunday @ promotional price (about SGD200) for my wedding proposal, it was a very worthwhile spend. The room is spacious for my decorations, very well maintain and clean. Everything just looks very new from corridor to the room inside. Nothing to criticize about. The hotel crews are very friendly and always greeted me with smiles. Wifi speed is reasonably fast and also I learnt that the hotel provides a free mobile handset that has unlimited data usage to carry around for every room (thumbs up! even though I am a local and has no usage for it). As for location wise, it is strategically located at Tanjong Pagar MRT station which is near to the CBD area. Love the food choices and the convenience brought forth by NTUC supermarket around the hotel. I would

title: Very comfortable stay in a great location
desc: Stayed four nights for the start of our holiday and we were delighted with the wonderful service and elegant room. Staff polite, quick and helpful. Room service was very nice and complimentary mini bar with Aussie Mars Bars was the icing on the cake! Room was clean and bright, lovely rainfall shower, water pressure wasn't very strong but not a problem at all. Great bath and lovely to have a window in the bathroom for natural light. Air con whisper-quiet and cool. We were very comfortable. Requested a toddler cot for our two year old. We had a proper wooden cot and mattress delivered which was great, but it was set very high (for under 6 month old) so was a bit worried he would fall out! Changing the height would have required a screwdriver so we just kept watch and everything

title: Singapore Accommodation
desc: My sheets were dirty so I called cleaning and they come straight away to change them for me. You get free calls to landlines anywhere and free WIFI, there is also a mobile phone for you to use in and around Singapore to communicate and find your way around. Seems to be everything that you require there is a nice rooftop bar, we didn't eat in the hotel so not sure what the food is like.

title: Nice modern hotel
desc: This is a comfortable, modern hotel which, although not in a tourist area is close to the MRT for sightseeing. There is a nice pool area. We had a spacious room with views over the harbour. Good in room facilities. Reception staff were very welcoming.

title: Wonderful Stay at a High Standard Hotel
desc: I came to the Carlton City Hotel on the way home to Perth after a disappointing 8 nights in Penang. It was just wonderful to arrive at such a high standard hotel, I could not pick any faults with the hotel or staff. I upgraded to a Club room which was well worth the money for all the additional benefits. I will definitely stay there on future trips. Just one suggestion to future guests is to remember to ask for a room away from the elevators if you want quiet...I request this at all hotels I stay at. Location is excellent, close to MRT, local shopping and dining and great coffee shops. The Carlton also offered a free mobile which I will use next time I stay for a longer holiday.

title: Short stopover was perfect
desc: 2 full days stopover in Singapore en-route from Thailand to Australia was a good way to end our holiday. Staying somewhere that was central to attractions and transport was going to be essential and the Carlton City Hotel was just the answer. But on top of that we found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable, very helpful and friendly staff from the moment we arrived to catching the taxi to the airport. We stayed in one of the top floors which enabled us to frequent the club room for breakfast and evening drinks. Certainly would recommend this hotel.

title: Very good hotel in financial district
desc: Luxury hotel located in the financial district. Staff very nice and kind, rooms pretty big and well maintained. Rooftop bar have a beautiful view. Also the breakfast and the restaurant offer a good variety of food.

title: Great Hotel in Excellent Location
desc: Two couples stayed at The Carlton City Hotel and we all loved it. Check in was quick and friendly. The Rooftop Bar has great views and is a good spot to share a drink especially in the evening. The location is an easy walk to lots of places such at Smith Street which is also called Food Street. The Hotel is quiet and the bed was very comfortable. Our room was spacious and comfortable with great views over the city. Singapore is a fantastic city and in April the weather is hot and fine. We will definitely stay at The Carlton City Hotel when next in Singapore.

title: Good business hotel
desc: Stayed here in April for a few days. Hotel is clean well run and in a good location. It's a pretty standard business hotel and there is little to differentiate it from other business hotels around the world. The gym in the hotel is not bad....as hotel gyms go. I would stay here again if I was in Singapore.

title: Great Stay !
desc: Carlton city is in a very convenient location for a business traveler. Rooms is quite comfortable and cozy. The front desk managers are not that friendly and not ready to spend time with guests. Breakfast also need some improvement , adding some more varieties are important. Lovely pool and well maintained !!!!!!!!

title: Superb hotel ideally situated for exploring
desc: This is a lovely hotel, located a few minutes walk from China Town in Singapore, this means you are close to the MRT and Hop on/off buses. The hotel and rooms was very clean, nice rooms, comfy bed and very quiet. The view was not so good for me, but I was hardly in the room anyway. The staff were great and as expected always smiling and polite. The free stuff in the fridge every day is a great touch, something all hotels should do instead of charging crazy prices for a bottle of juice. I also love the fact I could lie back in the bath and watch TV in the room â€“ small things hey lol If you are in Singapore just go to the local restaurants for food, especially the Korean places around the corner and China Town of course. For getting around the MRT is good but you miss all the

title: Great value and fantastic location!
desc: Booked 6 months before we arrived booked two rooms and got a great deal through expedi. Arrived around 10am and was lucky to we could check in to our rooms thank you for that after no sleep coming on the 1am flight from our hoilday from Sri Lanka. We stayed 3 night and all the staff where very helpful taxis ready in min. The roof top bar was lovely and great service. Will stay again fantastic hotel.

title: Haven't got my deposit refund and it's been 3 weeks since my departure!
desc: I was told that I would get my deposit refund within one week after check-out. It's been 3 weeks since I left Singapore and I still haven't got my refund or any emails from Carlton City Hotel to notify me about the status. It's quite upsetting. Other than that the hotel itself is nice, clean and convenient. It is in a very good location and has a metro station and a 24H super market nearby. I'd recommend this hotel, but be aware of its deposit policy. Ask for your refund upon check-out if possible.

title: Excellent service, nice facilities
desc: Perfect for your business stay in Singapore, the location is ideal to reach all destinations in the center. The swimming pool offers a refreshing break at the end of a long hot day around the city, and the restaurant has a delicious morning buffet. Don't miss the japanese-style buffet for lunch when available, but try to profit of the special offers which often are available. A free mobile phone with internet connection is available to guests for the length of the stay, very practical when wandering around trying to find an address. The classy touch during our stay is that we checked out in the morning and spent the day visiting the city; when we came back in the evening to pick up our luggage before heading for the airport, the made available a room for us for a shower and

title: Club Room - Carlton City Hotel
desc: The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. We opted for a Club Room mainly for access to the Club Room lounge and the coffee machine in the room. Breakfast was good and the lounge quiet. We were able to have a late check out of 3pm which was much appreciated. Location was near China Town. You can catch the MRT to Tanjong Pagar station and walk the 5 minutes to the hotel. Unfortunately, the room had a really musty wet smell. Not enough coffee pods in the room (only 3 to share between 2 people). Only 2 items of laundry per room included in the Club Room deal.

title: Singapore holiday
desc: All of the hotel staff were amazing especially all the concierge. In particular the concierge Nazir was outstanding in his grasp and understanding of the Australian language and culture which made for a pleasant and easy experience. He was able to offer assistance in matters relating to what to do, how to get there and he knew how to connect with the Aussies.

title: good business hotel and location
desc: Close to business district, near train station and plenty f good restaurants. Very new so everything works well. Staff are friendly, pool is good size, recommended. Takes a while for hot water to reach your room at high floors.

title: Poor support on
desc: I reserve the hotel stating that we are going to have child stay in hotel. Before the trip I send email to check the available bed fence. They reply me only have baby cots and it is fully booked. And offer me no alternative help. For those go with child, better reconsider other hotel

title: Top hotel in a great location!
desc: What a fantastic hotel, great location, wonderful friendly attentive staff, delicious breakfast, and restaurant was tops! Particularly loved the consierage who went out of their way to help us with trips etc. a fantastic week there looking forward to our next stay late May!

title: Excellent Location and Great Service
desc: Friends and I recently stayed at the Carlton City Hotel. This couldn't of been a better choice for us. The hotel has a great location within walking distance to Chinatown and not too far from Clarke Quay. The rooms were very spacious and clean. They are modern and very comfortable. The staff at this hotel offers the best customer service, they are all very friendly and professional. Beside the front desk most of my dealings were with Mr. Nizar at the concierge's desk. He is awesome to deal with and very knowledgeable with the area and all the local day tours and restaurants. He took care of all of our needs. This hotel worked out great for our group and the value was amazing.

title: Great Location
desc: The hotel's location in the CBD may not make it a conventional tourist hotel but I was pleasantly surprised by the number of amenities and its proximity to numerous points of interest. The Tanjong Pagar, Telok Ayer and Chinatown districts offer a slew of hip restaurants, bars and cafes, while Orchard Road and the civic and cultural districts were a mere 10 minute taxi/MRT ride away. The Tanjong Pagar MRT station located around the corner also made connection seamless to all parts of the island even at peak hour. Rooms and facilities were well appointed and public areas such as the pool and restaurants were generally quiet and filled with business travelers, couples and older travelers. I would highly recommend the Carlton City for both business and pleasure.

title: Great Hotel in a good location!!
desc: A great hotel at a mid-range price in Singapore. The rooms were large, clean and had plenty of amenities. The pool was clean and refreshing and the gym was adequate if you wanted to get in workout. A shelf by the window was great for storing luggage. The food and beverage charges were typically overpriced as most hotels. However, there was a market across the street and another next door that was great for snack foods and drinks. The hotel was in a great location also. Only a 5 minute walk to the MRT station where you could get almost anywhere in Singapore. The front desk was very helpful in providing information on places to go and how to get there on the MRT. If you don't mind walking, it's about a 10-minute walk to Chinatown and a 25-minute walk to the Marina.

title: Awesome hotel in a great location
desc: This was my second stay at Carlton City, and I'd definitely come back again. Super modern design, well-appointed rooms, and great staff make it an awesome place to stay. The location, a block from Tanjong Pagar MRT, is central to CBD and other points of interest. Additionally, there are TONS of great restaurants and bars nearby, and the hawker market across the street is great for cheap eats.

title: Two day stopover
desc: Had s good couple of days staff were friendly and attentive will stay here again Rooms were clean and well maintained stayed in the club room worth it Hotel located by china town Had no problems arranging trips

title: Excellent
desc: Ideal location, near MRT and buses. If you don't want to pay the normal hotel food prices there's a really good choice of cheaper local places to eat/drink. Good facilities, small pool and gym, nice bar. Rooms good size, modern, very clean. Exactly like the photos! Pleasant and helpful staff. Manager comes to desk if you ask- you are not fobbed off like so many other places. Good free wifi. Rooms quiet. Comfy beds. Would recommend. Saw the hotel other family members stayed in and so glad we booked here!

title: Fantastic
desc: Having stayed at CCH very shortly after its initial opening, I was looking forward to my return and was not disappointed. As Singapore hotel prices rocket, CCH offers a fair rate for a very good standard of room / facilities. It is located in Tanjong Pagar which still has remnants of "old Singapore" and is handy for many great dining options. It is a short walk from MRT so is convenient for those visiting as tourists. Don't let the "off the beaten track" location put you off, for service / cost / value, this has to be one of the best options in Singapore. Enjoyed Sky Bar very much although could use more tables and chairs up there as even when only a few folk in, there are no seats left. Just saying.

title: Almost flawless
desc: I just spent 4 nights at this great place. Very convenient as location, as per its facilities and by the professional attitude of its staff. The breakfast buffet is very good, with both local and international options ( and it is included). The pool and gym area in the third floor are very nice, although the gym is a little bit small. I don 't understand why the gym closes at 10:30pm and is open only from 6:30am; maybe here there is room for improvement. The rooms are modern, with some international power outlets which fits all of them. Wifi free and easy to use. The low pressure of water might be also something to be improved, but this is minor compared to all the great features you have. Not to mention the free mobile offered by the hotel: very helpful. All in all, a

title: Family holiday in Singapore
desc: Very good hotel. Impressive and professional staff. Close to all amenities. Average taxi fare not more than s$10. Top floor bar and restaurants are average. But don't miss the coffee shop at the foyer. Happy and enjoyable experience.

title: GREAT HOTEL
desc: I booked last minute by OTA and get very good price for this hotel. Surprisely, this hotel was very great and very clean. location is just 5 minutes walking by MRT station Tanjong Pagar. The breakfast is very excellent. I give 5 thumbs for Calrton City Hotel Singapore. Thanks

title: Great hotel in a wonderful location
desc: I was recently in Singapore for business for 5 days. The hotel was perfect in every way. I would definitely stay there again on my next visit. The hotel is located minutes away from a metro station and within walking distance of shopping, restaurants, bars, and Chinatown. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The bathrooms are large, clean and have both a separate bath and shower stall. The wifi was excellent, although you do have to reconnect each time you leave the hotel. Breakfast buffet was extensive and the coffee was excellent. I also used the exercise room each morning, which is small and in high demand - probably my only recommendation to the hotel is to expand the exercise facilities and equipment. If you get there early/late, you can have your choice of

title: Carlton City
desc: Good points Location close to harbor, pleasant walks just a five minute stroll to China town. Nice clean rooms with good wifi connection. Friendly helpful staff Bad Points No shopping mall within walking distance Coffee shop in lobby is expensive

title: Good, but not perfect
desc: I have a feeling I booked this thinking I was getting the Carlton Hotel, where I have stayed before. No matter, it is perfectly good. I had a room on the 20th floor with a magnificent view. There were a few things about the room that puzzled me. For one thing it has a plethora of light switches, and it took me a good while to finally plunge the room into total darkness. The smart TV is perhaps not an improvement on a dumb TV as it was rather slow to respond to the remote, but had a good range of channels. The bed was huge and very comfortable, and the room is stylish. The bathroom is really odd in that it has a huge window looking out into the bedroom. This does mean you can lie in the bath and watch the TV but it also means that anyone in the bedroom has an excellent view

title: Nice Hotel
desc: We stayed for a week, our room was on the 25th floor, great views. Room was modern,very clean, lovely deep soaking bath tub. We paid a little extra for the Club Lounge benefits, well worth it. Benefits include full buffet breakfast, & drinks and nibbles from 6;00pm to 8:00pm every night. Hotel has it's own excellent restaurant and a cafe in the beautifully appointed lobby, as well as a very comfy bar area. Definitely will be back.

title: Singapore holiday
desc: The hotel was very well situated close to most things ,rooms were classy and clean ,staff were helpful and friendly especially Concierge Nizar who went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable,he is a great asset to this establishment EXCELLENT!

title: Excellent friendly hotel
desc: Stayed at the Carlton City Hotel at the end of April after a very busy holiday in Cambodia. The hotel is in a great location, rooms are spotless, only thing I have a slight negative comment on is we had booked for a triple room only to discover that the room we had was the same size as a double room, so it was a tight squeeze. All staff were very friendly and welcoming each day,a special mention to the concierge staff at the front especially NIzar nothing was a bother he always went out of his way to help with anything we required...a five star credit to this hotel.....would definitely recommend this hotel.... Many thanks to all staff for making the end of our holiday wonderful

title: Has Potential to be better
desc: We go to Carlton city because it is so close to my husband's office when we are there but it falls short of a 4* North American hotel. It is nice. The pool and gym area are nice but the rooms smell a little moldy and we couldn't adjust our AC to cooler temps. No coffee makers in room, just a kettle. I know this is probably standard in Malaysian hotels but it would be nice to have a nespresso machine. Breakfast was included, it was good but not tremendous and both mornings the coffee machine was making a fuss. I ended up waiting to go to Starbucks. They did offer us a free phone to use while we were here, so that was nice. All in all okay but I have seen better.

title: Exceptional hotel!
desc: Stayed here for a few nights last month. The staff were incredibly welcoming at all times and the room was very comfortable. I especially enjoyed being greeted with a smile every time I visited the club lounge daily for breakfast. The location of the hotel is also perfect so will definitely be staying here again when I visit Singapore in the near future on business.

title: Looking forward to staying for a vacation in the future
desc: About to check out in a few hours. Stayed during the FHA 2016 Expo in a room registered under a colleagues' name. Could've given 5 star but wasn't able to fully enjoyed the Hotel's facilities even with a 4 night stay due to work. But service is world class and everybody are very hospitable. Kudos to Lea at the Front Desk for being patient to our confusing requests and professional in her work. The Handy mobile phone feature in the room as part of the amenities is very useful with its free local Cal's and limited free international calls. Until next time.

title: convenient location, close to chinatown
desc: The hotel is located close to Chinatown. There are 2 supermarkets just across the street. Very convenient to shop local food and snacks. I was late check in at almost 1 o'clock and found my TV can't function. The staff helped me to check and replaced a TV box in the middle of the night. A mobile phone is equipped in each room with unlimited 4G and also free local and international call (selected countries). But remember to install your usual apps a night before as the installation takes time. The breakfast buffet is tasty.

title: Great place to stay
desc: Carlton City is a great place to stay. Clean rooms, spacious in size and the best part is that it is very near to the department stores and the lunch places. It is also conveniently located near some of the fun places. One thing to be aware is that every time I asked for an extra towel it took them very long to get those, sometimes they didn't get the towel. We enjoyed our stay.

title: Great Service and Excellent Location
desc: A great place to say in terms of staff's service and location. Easily accessible to public transport including train station and F & B outlets. More importantly, was the motivated and great service oriented staff who made my stay most memorable.They are from the Club Lounge : Farouq, Jackie, Michele, Sheik, Hardi (Duty Manager), Shaari Jamal (Front Office Manager) and Sabaria. Sales : Chloe and Raphael. Reservations : Constance. Housekeeping : Ms Han. They were friendly, accommodating and served with passion and smiles. Certainly an asset to the Organisation. A Comfortable hotel in a great location.

title: New and clean hotel
desc: Stayed there for two nights with my wife and son for s starvation. Very quiet hotel that is brand new. Bed and furnishing is completely new. I think the hotel vacancy is quite high. No lines and very quiet. My booking does not come with breakfast and cost like $29 per adult if I want to eat the buffet there. Looked at the spread and don't think it is worth the. Money.

title: will come back for sure
desc: stayed with my friend twice in this hotel. we love this hotel so much. neighborhood is nice, near to the ramen king and lots of coffeeshop nearby. hotel was quite with a beautiful room. very huge room in my opinion. bedding was great and they have a beautiful bathroom as well. mrt access was real close to hotel. they have fairprice nearby too..

title: New and stylish hotel
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights with family. The location of the hotel is good, 5 minutes outdoor walk to MRT station. The hotel is very new and stylish and the staff are friendly. There are some low-priced bakery shops and restaurants nearby in case you want a local breakfast.

title: Good location for business
desc: I spent 10 days here on business and was happy with my stay. The room was comfortable, the service was great and the amenities were good. The coffee shop/patisserie on the ground floor opposite reception has good coffee, the pool area is quite nice, and the gym, although small, serves its purpose. The room rates were good.

title: Comfortable / Modern / Convenient
desc: Stayed here for a week in May while in Singapore on business. This hotel is very new. Very nice room layout. Fittings and features are all top notch. Every detail has been thought out with the guests convenience in mind. Great bathrooms. Nice views. Excellent pool / gym. Great buffet breakfast Very nice rooftop bar. Extremely convenient if you are doing business in the down town area. Lots of niche / boutique local and international restaurants in walking distance. Highly recommend this hotel. Has a 5 star feel to it.

title: Convenient and clean
desc: We are here on my husband's business. Stayed here last year same time for the same reason. We found this hotel to be such a convenient spot for transport , food etc. lots of different restaurants around here. Tanjong Pagar MRT is just around the corner. Very comfortable bed. After sleeping in hard beds in Pataya and Bangkok for the last 2 weeks, the comfortable bed here is such a treat. Staff are friendly. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointing
desc: I stayed here once before in 2014 and this hotel is sliding down. On arrival there is a note of stale air. I asked for a high room which I received (club room) for a small extra charge. The room again suffered from a stale musty smell, but it's ok I was advised by reception when I advised them that "that's normal as they don't get used that much!!". Room was clean and had fab views. I would not recommend eating here either not the greatest.

title: Disappointed
desc: Stayed two nights on way back from Vietnam. A bit disappointed with this hotel. First up, taxi drivers are confused between Carlton Hotel and Carlton City Hotel. You have to repeatingly tell them that you want Carlton City, even then the driver took us to Carlton hotel from the airport. Why you would have two hotels with similar names in the same city is beyond me. The hotel just lacks soul, no vibe....you book in at the reception and that's it. No staff to open front door, no one with a welcoming smile, no turn down service with nightly chocolates on the pillow. I think we were spoilt with the service in Vietnam. The room was okay, no problems there but the club room is very dead....no atmosphere at all, hardly anybody goes there. No beers during the day until 6pm and then

title: Good hotel, convenient location and free use of smartphone.
desc: Stayed here at the start and end of recent holiday. The rooms are comfortable and a reasonable size for a city hotel. Good location for Chinatown or CBD. But in reality no where is very far in the city. Didn't eat in the hotel but spent one afternoon relaxing at the pool which was shaded for most of that time. No hesitation in recommending this place.

title: I love Singapore
desc: This is a beautiful hotel,it has stunning swarovski Crystal lighting in the foyer,air conditioning, lovely pool,breakfast was well laid out with hot cooked or continental on offer.The staff were very friendly and helpful.The rooms were large with a bath & shower in them.Very modern rooms.The hotel was very near to MRT so getting about was easy. Tip is to buy a 3 day ticket it will save you money.The MRT is so simple to use you can get all over quickly and easily. Everyone speaks English even on the MRT & buses. Singapore has beautiful shopping malls,lots of places to eat,stunning art work & sculptures all over.It's such a beautiful colourful place,lovely flowers everywhere. Chinatown is a great place to get your bargins,International plazas is great for food at night,Clarke Quay

title: well located and corresponding to Carlton standards
desc: very well situated hotel corresponding to what you expect from a Carlton hotel; given the very high prices in Singapore, this is really an hotel to be chosen if you are able to get a special deal; rooms are big, well equipped, with large and comfortable beds. We did not take the breakfast; given all the food corners and coffee shops you have in Singapore breakfasts not worth paying for in the hotels

title: Really nice stay.
desc: The bathroom was awesome. The room was big, clean and very comfortable. There were personal touches, like a welcome message on the TV when we first stepped into the room. Good location near Tanjong Pagar with lots of food. Great stay!

title: Good hotel
desc: Great place with everything you need and located in the Central business district. You can walk to nice restaurants. Good value for money. The staff is really friendly. When my taxi driver did not accept creditcard payment, they smoothly fixed it for me.

title: Strategic located hotel with nice services
