desc: Stayed here for two weeks during a business travel. The room is spacious and has a nice view (mine was facing the pool and other buildings, my friend's was facing the park). They also provide safe, drawers, iron and iron board on the closet. The hotel has super easy access. It's near to metro station (Tanjong Pagar) which means access to all over Singapore and one easy transit from/to Changi airport. Foods are easy to get from here. Korean, Chinese, Indonesian foods in Chinatown are just 5-10 minutes walking distance. Convenient stores and fast food like Subway are at 100am malls just across the street. Try also an India/Pakistani food stalls called Akbar 24 hours with its generous portion. The hotel restaurant has a pretty decent food, but I really wish they vary their menu a

title: Good location and comfortable
desc: We stayed 5 nights in May - my first stay in Singapore. We chose this hotel from Trip Adviser reviews and location. The hotel appears to be relatively new and is very well located. You can walk to Chinatown. The MRT less than 10 mins walk. And lots of restaurants nearby. We did however find the hotel a little soul-less. It is quiet, clean and modern but for us, lacked a bit of warmth when staying for a length of time. I think for business visits or overnight stays it would be great. I did find the incredible make up mirror in the bathroom to be a huge plus! And the concierge staff were always there to get us a cab when required. However the fridge in our room was as good as useless. You can't actually fit anything in it and it was only mildly cold. We had only 2 glasses in the

title: Comfortable room; convenient location
desc: Room is big enough, bright and clean; with comfortable bed. I came with my parents (elderly) and thank you Ms Choo for the room arrangement. I like the breakfast - food choices are adequate. The coffee machine makes nice coffee too. Since my parents are not used to the spicy food in Singapore they are very happy that the breakfast offers them nice selection of both western and Chinese breakfast items. Staff are nice and helpful. I am glad that I chose Carlton City for this trip. I will definitely recommend the hotel.

title: Nice hotel!
desc: The Executive room we had was quite spacious, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was fine (though the shower was a bit odd), breakfast was fine, the gym & pool were nice and clean, room rate was acceptable and location close to Chinatown is perfect.

title: Good location and service
desc: Being only a 10 - 15 minute walk away from Chinatown and 5 min from one of the green line train stations it makes it easy to access all the sights that Singapore has to offer. The staff were extremely friendly, one member of staff supplying us with his personal umbrella as the hotel ran out of guest umbrellas. They even supplied a smartphone for each room wich had loaded maps, points of interest and standard smartphone functions. The concierge was also extremely helpful in accommodating for our early flight and booking a taxi. The only thing that I would say is that the rooms could have been better given the age of the hotel. The bathroom had no exhaust fan and as a result, there was already signs of damp patches in the ceiling above the shower.

title: Very cost effective hotel
desc: I Visit this Hotel several times (about 10) last time was June 2016. It's was after renovation, and every place was new and clean. The restaurant is big and modern, have all kind of dishes, from 24-26 floor is VIP rooms with all the goodies and separate restaurant. The view from those rooms is marvelous around the hotel the buildings are low so the view is 360 degrees . the location of the hotel is near Waterloo Rd. Benefit for people who need to access Synagogue or Church.

title: Good Hotel, Great Location
desc: Great hotel for business meetings, met several clients in the lobby. Subway is essentially across the street, so location was great. Room was clean and comfortable, even gave you a smart phone for free. But their wifi was temperamental, had to sign in every time I walked into the room.

title: Good location
desc: Location is good for business people. Close to banks. Walking distance to mrt. Breakfast is good. Room is spacious and clean. Internet in room is fast. Staffs are very helpful and will guide you through the city.

title: Excellent hotel with beautiful lobby and very helpful staff
desc: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days on a family holiday and absolutely adored this hotel. From the exquisite lobby orchid centre piece to the all around plushness of the hotel, I felt like a king! Spotlessly clean, not a spec of dirt anywhere, beds very comfortable and air conditioning was excellent. The staff were super kind & helpful. My camera tripod broke one of the days and the bar man was kind enough to actually fix it! Definitely worth the money to stay here

title: Good business Hotel
desc: good : 1. location, easy to find food shops around the area, near mrt 2. ntuc fair price across the street 3. nice and clean room improvement : 1. service from the receptionist 2. takes quite sometimes to check in and check out

title: Nice and spacious!
desc: We stayed in Carlton City Hotel for 4 nights. Location is quite convenient that both China Town and railway station are within the walkable distance. Supermarket, restaurants are just next to the hotel. Moreover, Room is spacious, cozy and modern.

title: Clean???!? Not this hotel
desc: Came for this hotel after reading all the reviews about how clean this place is.. One thing I can say for sure, this is the most not clean rooms I've seen, and I am living in hotels due to my work in the last two years.. And they offered me to check other rooms , so it's not just a single room. I booked the hotel for few weeks but after one night my breath was heavy due to the amount of dust in the room ( and I am not allergic) ... Moisture signs in the bathroom all over, walls with human waste.. Really awful and so expensive. Till now I can't understand what am I seeing wrong then all the rest of the reviews around mentioned totally different experience. Sorry, but I wouldn't pay half of the rate I've charged per night , not worth it. Oh, and the TV didn't work too.

title: Take the upgrade
desc: Great hotel, well placed near to Tajong Pajar MRT stop. Nice rooms and pool. If you can upgrade to the club floor which for around Â£30 per night per room gives you a bigger better room, free breakfast, evening cocktails/drinks/hors douvres and some laundry. Good value as Singapore is quite pricey.

title: Purely Business!!
desc: As hotels go, this venue is very clean, quite comfortable and well located. However, it is definitely for business people - it is not at all child friendly, and I am sure that if an amorous couple wanted to enjoy this venue, they would be sorely disappointed. A couple of plusses - they provide a free android phone in each room to make unlimited local and international calls and internet. I have not seen this before - it really is a good idea. The downside is that the phone in my room does not work. Good idea, poor executions. There is a nice bar on the top floor (the Graffiti Sky Bar) - they have a happy hour from 5pm to 8pm, and the view is actually quite good. The lighting is poor and as they have an uneven floor, I would advise that you tread with caution - I nearly

title: Convenient for Chinatown and MRT
desc: Stayed at CC hotel for 5 days in early June. A large hotel that seems to be just outside the city downtown area but conveniently close to Tajong Pagar MRT (rail) station (EW15). Only SD2.50 standard ticket from airport and a couple of minutes to trundle across to the hotel. I was a lone female traveller but felt quite safe using the TMR. I stayed on a B&B basis and had a room on the 6th floor. Room had iron and board, kettle and small supply of instant coffee, t bags etc. I prefer breakfast tea but on some days the standard 2 t bags were jasmine or earl grey.....so instead I collected a couple of breakfast t bags from the breakfast room. You also get complimentary bottled water in the rooms but the room info does state that the tap water is drinkable, so I was quite happy to use

title: Perfect!
desc: Simply perfect. That's why I keep coming back. The room was spotlessly clean and looked as good as it did a year ago when I first stayed here. As a light sleeper, I am very fussy about my bed but I simply love the premium bedding here... So comfortable that I slept like a baby! Checking in was a breeze. The folks at the front desk were professional, efficient and friendly. I think this is the most underrated hotel in Singapore! Great value for money and a true gem.

title: Perfection
desc: We choose this wonderful hotel on a whim. We were looking for a great hotel within walking distance to everything and it had to have an awesome pool. This hotel met and exceeded our expectations. Everybody from the reception staff, room attendants, concierge and bar staff were so friendly. Our room was perfect and the pool deck was so relaxing. The graffiti sky bar provided the perfect backdrop to celebrate my birthday and those lovely surprise cupcakes provided by the management were appreciated. We will definitely be returning on our next trip.

title: Excellent Hotel
desc: Girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights at the beginning of June. All the staff were great especially Nazar,who booked all our tours,Raj the bellman and Vincent who worked in the restaurant Ã t breakfast time.Nothing was pto much trouble for the staff and if in Singapore again would stay there.

title: Easy, clean, new, great location
desc: We stayed three nights, room adequately sized for two on a short stay, bathroom contemporary and clean, king bed and pillows were super comfortable - we had the best sleeps, and our room on the 20th floor (2022) was very quiet and had a great view out to the port. Avoid coffee downstairs, although it was good it was very expensive, there's a great little cafe called 'The Plain' at 50 Craig Road off Tanjong Pagar Road about 2-3 mins walk.

title: Great location & innovation
desc: It was my first visit to this hotel and I would like to share my experience for future travelers. The reason I had selected was location. Easy access to city tour buses(red, yellow and blue line) and quiet place to stay compared to my last stay at Orchard road. And I can say that it was great benefit for travelers. Overall facilities(morden style) and guest service were also recommendable. All staff was kind enough to anticipate my needs. Especially, Mr. Ali Aktar from concierge was always there when I needed something (he is the member of Les Clefs d'or and the badge on his chest shows the level of service). The greatest part I would like to recommend this hotel is a mobile device provided to every guest room. You can use and carry this mobile phone during your stay and free

title: Good service
desc: We drove from KL early morning to go to USS. Stop by the hotel to drop our bags around 10am, waay before check in time. It was our lucky day, the hotel allowed us to check in early since there is room available. And the room was on Executive floor and harbour bay virw. My husband told them that we jst got married. Surprisingly, when we came back from USS at night there were fruits, chocs and congrats card in the room! So sweet of them. Its nothing fancy but thoughts that count! Room very spacious, clean and seems new. We love our short stay! Defit recomend to all. Thanks again!

title: One night, very efficient
desc: I wouldn't choose this area again, it doesn't really have much going on, compared to more central hotels, but it does offer a good base for exploring. Best thing is the free mobile phones in the room. Very clean and tidy, good toiletries etc.

title: Good place to stay in central Singapore
desc: stayed for a biz trip overall a good hotel with central location close to CBD and some tourist spots staff is helpful and attentive nothing to complain really walking distance from station which is on same line as Changi airport

title: New hotel with an ok location
desc: The hotel itself is new and clean. Staff are friendly. Rooftop bar is worth a visit. Try and get the happy hour deal. Thanks to the bar tender zin min. Very cheerful and friendly character. Mrt is about 5 min walk. Opposite is a 24h supermarket which is great to have. Two food courts are also nearby. Great chicken rice at maxwells food court (3 minute walk)

title: 40 mins waiting for 2 bottles of water
desc: This is my first time staying at Carlton City and unluckily experience the inattentive service. The housekeeping forgot to provide 2 bottles of water which they normally provide on daily basis. I called the Carlton Touch around 10PM, the staff picked up the phone and agreed to arrange the water which I've requested, 15 mins later nothing happened. I've dialed again to Housekeeping itself, another staff picked up and, again, nothing happened. I needed to dial to reception and finally I got my 2 bottles of water.

title: Many pleasant surprises
desc: We gstayed 4 nights at the Carlton City while visiting my daughter who was on a six month consulting assignment. Her company recommended several hotels and we chose this one, and we were not disappointed. The staff from top to bottom was excellent and was always willing to satisfy our needs. The room was great and clean and the location was excellent for us as our daughter's serviced apartments was only one block away and the Tanjung Pagar MRT station was basically behind the hotel. Additionally there were numerous dining possibilities located nearby. The best surprise at the hotel was the "Handy" cellular phone that you can use without any cost while staying at the hotel. It provides unlimited local calls, unlimited international calls to certain countries including the US,

title: executive treatment
desc: Just had a recent 6 night stay for leisure, it was a return visit and very happy that my request for an executive end room with city view was acknowledged. The executive room was clean and spacious and the king size bed was very comfortable. I enjoyed relaxing so much it was hard to leave every day. The hotel now has a complimentary mobile phone that is most useful for free local and international calls,internet etc. I was offered a special breakfast deal at check in that was most enjoyable. My room had some minor issues that was no ones fault and I was promptly upgraded to a higher club room. My thanks once again to the General Manager Darren, Executive Assistant Manager Augustine and Front Office Manager Shaari for their personal contact and ensuring I had a pleasant stay. I

title: good location to MRT, but there are rooms for improvement
desc: -excellent location to MRT and about 5 mins walk to Tanjong Pagar -24 hours supermarket, convenience store nearby -5 mins walk to Chinatown -free smartphones with unlimited data and call time provided however, several negative impressions during my 4 nights stay at 5/F -numerous and visible dusts on desk and furniture -spider web hanging along the ceiling just above the bed -television is based on the internet's performance, however, wifi and its speed is very very bad and unacceptable, had to reboot the television every few mins due to low speed of the internet

title: Great location
desc: Great location. Pleasant walk to centre and Marina Bay. Also very close to Chinatown and several good restaurants. Very short walk to MRT, also served by buses. The room was very good. Nice bathroom with both bath and shower. Free use of handy phone with mobile data and free calls locally and to UK was great. Although hotel receptionist told me that they would only charge my credit card on departure, I was charged for whole 3 night stay right after checking in without my knowledge. Didn't cause a problem, but unprofessional. The outside swimming pool, although a fair size, was on the third floor, so always on the shadow of other buildings.

title: Concierge manager and staff
desc: My husband and I spent 5 days at Carlton City Hotel our stay there was great really impressed with our room and bathroom very clean. Location was good as we were always able to either walk, taxi or train station very close by. We must make mention of Nizar who was working a lot of the days we were there always extremely friendly remembered our names as well as great at recommending places to go assisting wherever possible. Nizar was at the concierge desk as a manager and along with his fellow staff were excellent hope I have spelt his name correctly. As for the front desk we did not at any time require assistance so I wont make a comment but did greet us as we walked past to the elevator. Both my husband and I would definitely stay there again.

title: Nice location Good hotel
desc: Stayed in this hotel for almost 2 weeks. I would stay there again. The rooms were good there is the city view and harbour view, I had one of each. Having stayed there for so long in a conference, the food became quite monotonous as we ate the buffet every lunchtime. Actually, really boring. Thankfully, one of our colleagues complained and they actually changed the menu. (So, ask about this if you will stay for a long time) Many places you can walk to also nearby. The hotel is quite small and compact as a whole. I used the club floor and frequented the lounge. The staff were very nice everywhere. I would definitely recommend and stay here again.

title: Good Stay in SIngapore CBD
desc: I stayed in Carlton for about 4 days in July 2016. I had an excellent experience. The room was specious with all modern amenities. The in room dining service was also good and there were a lot of options for vegetarians. I enjoyed the breakfast. Most of the offices are within the walking distance from this place.

title: Good hotel with a price/quality higher than average
desc: I stayed there for 7 months and after my experience I can say that if I ever go back to Singapore, this would still be my choice. The restaurant is ok, although nothing special (as all restaurants in Singapore) but it's not bad. The breakfast has pretty much everything you need and you also have a nice pool. The gym is small so sometimes it can be overcrowded. The rooms are very nice, modernly decorated with nice quality amenities.

title: Great Hotel
desc: Excellent position, short walk to MRT. Rooms very comfortable. Breakfast is hot and great choices, staff friendly and very helpful. Quite a few shops across the road from hotel and others within easy walking distance.

title: Outstanding service and quality hotel near mrt
desc: We were met with a smile upon arrival and our room was very nice. We had a massive discount all you can eat buffet dinner of high quality. The pool was adequate and gym serviceable. The location is on the edge of Chinatown and nearby maxwell centre for a great feed. It appears there is a nightlife area nearby. Across the road is a massive convenience store. The mrt is nearby and makes easy access to the rest of singapore. The coffee at the cafe downstairs is excellent and you can get a good priced breakfast there. Again service was outstanding there. We also received a phone for free calls including back home to Australia. Loved our stay

title: Perfect for the business traveller
desc: This is a great place for the corporate traveller. Well equipped comfortable rooms with complimentary wifi and mini bar packages available. Conveniently located and within waking distance of the business district. There's a number of bars and a hawker market close by too.

title: Work Business Trip - 15 hours ahead of west coast, good interent.. Where are you?
desc: The hotel itself is nice. The staff - nice The shower is okay. Pillows are nice, and the bed is nice. I am currently staying here now, and while there are a few "nice" things, nothing justifies the outrageous cost per night of this hotel - if work wasn't paying for it, I would have walked across the street to a different hotel. The internet is from the dark ages. For such a modern country, what's with the 1.5mpbs down speed? I can't work. The internet is so unbelievably slow. The shower has no water pressure. Singapore is naturally a very humid country - so showering with water pressure is a must. My AC didn't work for the first two nights - magically started working today. And finally the Room service is unbelievably expensive. Save your money, get more somewhere else.

title: Good, a bit noisy
desc: Pros: Very convenient location, close to Chinatown, MRT station and several restaurants. Friendly staff. Nice and modern design. Good quality breakfast, not really wide choice though. Cons: The noisy room: the hotel acoustic insulation appeared to be poor. The bell of some close room seemed our, some noise in the water pipes was very clearly heard in the night, other guests (not well educated, i believe) made a lot of noise with big laughing and chatting at midnight and we were disturbed. Another thing that was not ok was the quality of maintenance: the hotel is quite new and the magnifying mirror in the bathroom had two screws loosen out of three: impossible not realising the problem from the staff, so easily fixed that i did it myself. Absolutely not an issue, but annoying to

title: Conveniently located near the CBD
desc: Stayed one night while in Singapore for business. Enjoyed the close proximity to the CBD - the places I needed to go in Robinson Road were within walking distance. If you need to venture further taxis are aplenty, and the Tanjong Pagar MRT station is just behind the hotel (about 2mins walk). My room on the 18th floor was comfortable, the bathroom equipped with a bath tub and a rain shower (however I was looking for cotton buds after my shower but couldn't find any). Breakfast while not overly lavish was adequate with a reasonable range of options including dim sum, breads and pastries, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, and the usual eggs / sausages / bacon fare.

title: Overall a good hotel
desc: Came for site visit and food tasting. Overall a good hotel with good location. Just few mins walk from MRT station. Hotel room not that big but good enough for singles n couple. Hotel room is cosy and equipped with all necessities. Hotel is very near to business district and next to a mall 100Am mall.

title: Expensive but disappointed
desc: Stayed one night as a stop over en route to Sydney. On the surface this hotel ticks all the right boxes but in reality it was a disappointing stay. Other than the female concierge we found the staff all to be slightly rude. Check in was difficult, it wasn't the price quoted by bookings.com, they only gave one key and then it didn't work! Trying to struggle in and out of lifts with bags and suitcases when you have just flown 14 hours to get to the room and find the key won't work was highly frustrating. The breakfast was over priced for what there was available. The hotel was soulless and had no character. Overall I'm glad it was only a stop over and we were pleased to check out and get on with our holiday.

title: Great stay
desc: We loved it here, great staff & service a huge swimming pool and a little gym well equiped. I highly recomendd it so close to Chinatown and to Tajong Pajar MRT stop, very convenient and brilliantly run. Buy a pass card for everyday travel then use it to travel to airport. I highly recomend it. Helpful? Thank M00sej00se Report,

title: Comfy & luxurious, conveniantly located
desc: The Carlton provides all amenities of a 5* hotel in a great modern design. The rooms are spacious and well-designed, the pool area is pretty, the bar and coffeeshop in the lobby cater to all needs. Especially the staff in the lobby bar and coffeeshop as well as at the reception were incredibly nice and helpful. They shared a joke with you and were well-mannered.

title: Nice hotel with very convenient location
desc: I was staying in the Carlton City Hotel for 2 nights. It's located in a great location where I can go to the closest MRT station within 5-minute walk. It does not take much time for me to go to Orchard district for work. And I can grab lunch and dinner very easily - just around 2 - 3 MRT stops even I want to eat in the must-try restaurants recommended by the travel books and friends. And Sentosa is only 2 MRT stops away from the hotel which I can visit before getting on the flight in late pm. Overall, it was a pleasant experience with clean rooms and helpful staff.

title: Very good hotel - location and service
desc: Good value for money, great location - next to a metro station and next to Chinatown, with lots of bars and restaurants around. The rooms were clean with nice views on the higher floors. It's more of a business hotel and the staff are super helpful. We really enjoyed our stay!!!

title: Great Concierge Team, Needs to be Little More Cleaner
desc: Hotel is centrally located and makes it convenient to travel for meetings as the MTR is located near by. The concierge desk was very helpful and ever ready to assist and help whereas the others weren't even visible for much interaction or feedback. There were bugs/insects in the bathroom cubicle and they were present every single day, even after room cleaning the same situation each day. One day my hair clip feel and I had to pull the night stand in front to take out the same and was surprised to notice the cobwebs, outside cleaning there but inside I don't think they bother with. A little noisy though I don't know what the noise was all about. Other than the above, good hotel and everything in place and runs like a well oiled machine.

title: Great hotel, excellent staff
desc: I have been staying in this hotel for a few times, so when I was planning for a staycation and surprise for my wife, I did not hesitate to choose this hotel again. The rooms were clean and comfortable - as always. And you'll find the service attitude of the staff over there excellent. Thanks to Augustine, and the 2 gentlemen technicians who helped set up the tv and DVD player in the room.

title: New hotel, near MRT, great room n service
desc: I stayed for 5 nights for a work trip recently. There is a personalized greeting on the tv when u walk into the room which I thought was a nice personal touch. Room has a gigantic window that opens up to a view of the city. Gym is open 24 hours, small n pretty basic - 2 treadmills, 1 elliptical, 1 stationary bike, 1 pulley station, 2 benches n 1 dumbbell rack. Breakfast was tasty and range sufficient to please all sorts of folks - salad bar, Bircher muesli, small cheese n cold cut section, yogurt, naan n curry, standard western options with egg station, small dim sum selection, fruits, pastries n bread, porridge section n usual drink selection. Bed, pillow n linen were comfy and I did not have trouble sleeping. Bathroom was spacious with a tub m shower stall. The dressing table

title: Good location and nice breakfast
desc: We had two families travelled to Singapore between 9 to 16 July 2016. We stayed three nights to Carlton City Hotel between 9-12 July 2016. This hotel was generally good with good location, clean and tidy. Yet, I did not see good service here. When we arrived the hotel late on the first night around 8:30pm, they could not find two rooms side-by-side for us even if they promised in email. Also, the conciege was not sincere by pointing us to somewhere far for just supper even if we told him that we just wanted to have something simple as the kids were hungry. Given there were so many restarurants just nearby by less than half minutes walk.

title: Comfortable place with many convenient places just a walk away
desc: Room was bigger than I had thought, was very clean and the security is good as if you would want to access a level you would have to tap your room card to access. 24 supermarket just across the road, Mcdoanld's just 3 mins away, station just 5 mins away and many restaurants around the vicinity. The only down side was that the pool was a little Amal and so was the gym other than that everything was rather prefect! Would love to stay here again.

title: Great staycation at Carlton City Hotel!
desc: Stayed for: 1 Night in Executive Room (16-17 July 2016) Thank you for the amazing birthday staycation! Check-in: 10-15mins wait though it was of no fault of theirs as there were a few guests taking a longer time. Ours was done in 5 mins. Requested for a late-check out, and was given till 1pm instead of the usual before 12pm checkout time. Staff wished me a happy birthday, so thatâ€™s a good start to the day! Room: Our room was on the 20th floor, near the other end of the hallway. Lush carpeting and romantically lit hallway. Room was bigger than what we expected with a great view of the city through the high-glass windows. Room was brightly lit with lots of lights. Lights controls was clearly labelled. Aircon was good. Furniture: King-sized bed. Flat screen-tv (with a welcome

title: Great stay!
desc: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for only 2 nights and we really enjoyed it. We were able to store our luggage before and after check-in. It's a large hotel but they were able to get our room ready for 12 pm, exactly want we needed after an overnight flight. Definitely a bonus. Good modern room. We booked a King Bed room, the bed so so comfortable and big - it was great! I must admit we were travelling from Japan and have been sleeping on futons for 4 nights so that could have enhanced our experience. The hotel is based in Downtown so about 15 min walk to Clarke Quay and it's best to catch subway to the marina bay hotel.

title: Modern hotel
desc: I have spend a weekend in this hotel. It is located in a very self-sustain area , where restaurants, food center, supermarket, cafe, and shops are just around the corner. Free garage parking is available under the hotel building. Bed quality is very well. There are both shower and bath section in my room. Check in and out are quick and no queue during my stay.

title: Hotel near city center
desc: Carlton City Hotel is just couple minutes walk from Tanjong Pagah MRT station. Service is great. Room is new and spacious. Room lighting is sufficient. Surprising plus is 'handy', a mobile phone with internet for free to use during stay. Very nice. From the hotel, we can easily walk to main attractions in couple minutes.

title: Good location for short stay
desc: We stayed here for 4 days on the way back to London from Bali. The hotel is about an hour from the airport by train, the closest station to the hotel is Tanjong Pagar, a short walk over the road. The hotel is clean, modern and very tall! We were given a room on the 22nd floor and had great views of the surrounding area. Everything in the room was very modern and new, the bed was also very comfortable. The bathroom was large with both a shower and a bath, there is a window next to the bath which looks out to the bedroom but there is a blind if you wish to close it. There's a wardrobe with a ironing board/iron and free to use safe as well as a mini bar (chargeable). The hotel also provide a free to use smartphone in each room, you can use this to make free international calls as

title: Great stay for Business
desc: The Hotel is conveniently located at Tanjong Pagar, just walking distance to the CBD. Room was extremely spacious and comfortable. Service was top notch and accommodating. Singapore is very accessible by MRT and it certainly is a plus point that the train station is just 2 minutes away from the hotel. There is also plenty of excellent dining options just walking distance from the hotel. I would recommend: 1. Cake Spade the prettiest cake shop in the world and for also serving the best cheesecake ever - Speculoos Cookie Butter Cheesecake 2. Tendon Ginza for great value and excellent Tempura bowl 3. Superstar K the most popular Korean barbecue restaurant in the area 4. Keisuke Tonkotsu for the superb ramen broth with free flow eggs 5. Imperial Treasure Chinese Restaurant

title: Excellent Service
desc: The standard of service throughout the hotel was consistently excellent, with no shortcomings anywhere. The room was spacious and comfortable with a good vista of the harbour from Level 26. Always some activity to observe in a busy port. We took advantage of the Club Lounge facilities on Level 28 to enjoy breakfast with a view and complimentary hors d'oeuvres in the evening. The staff in the Club Lounge are exceptionally good at what they do, with Shek being a standout. A credit to the hotel. The location

title: Excellent staff
desc: We stay at four hotels in Singapor and we see that this hotel was the best of them. We stay five nights at the hotel , good location near the MRT station. the staff were very friendly ,polite help us very much from the check in to the check out

title: Good place to stay
desc: Researched Hotels in Singapore and went with this one & had a very happy stay. King Size rooms, very modern, good food in the evening, close to Tangan Pagor MRT (5 mins walk) and close to ChinaTown. Tip - have breakfast round the corner at the restaurant / cafe called Group Therapy - great place to mingle with the locals but blink & you will miss it (we nearly walked past it).

title: Disappointing
desc: The Carlton City has changed from a business hotel to a hotel comprising many young families. This was my third stay in as many years and overall it was a little disappointing I booked the Club room which is quiet and offers more personal service. Nice to see the introduction of sparkling wine at drinks however food choices for canapÃ©s were largely disappointing. Deep fried food when cold is not appealing. The breakfast choices were also cold and I was surprised to see small children in the club room. The pool area was also full of noisy children running, jumping and making it difficult for people to swim laps. No sun at the pool until the afternoon. The room itself was comfortable with the service provided here excellent.

title: Outstanding staff service
desc: Recommended by local work colleagues the Carlton City Hotel is an overall average hotel in terms of rooms, amenities and so forth but an outstanding feature would have to be the staff service. Without exception we found all the staff to be ultra friendly and professional. A good example of this was the General Manager, Darren, personally taking us to a local restaurant nearby as it was set out the back of shops and not visible from the road. An outstanding example of leadership and setting an example. Location wise there is a wide choice of restaurants nearby and bars, supermarkets and vegetable market. There is a great bar on the 28th floor with sweeping views out over the port - and again the staff were friendly and professional. Loved the service.

title: Affordable business hotel
desc: I used to stay at some of the more expensive hotels but decided to try the Carlton City because of its very competitive rate. I was not disappointed and would definitely recommend it as a more affordable option in Singapore. The room was fine and modern, it had lots of gadgets including a free mobile phone (sic!). A few points to note: - The save water policy is driven to a new level in their bathrooms. Expect delays with rinsing off soap and shampoo. - The WiFi is unreliable and weak - please fix this urgently, it's a business hotel after all. - They use a very strong detergent to clean the (bath) room - please consider a change, it leaves a very unpleasant smell.

title: Fantastic stay at Carlton City, Singapore
desc: We have just spent 3 nights in a Club Room. The Carlton Club lounge was far more than we expected with the service provided by Shek Ezra outstanding. A friendly welcome each night and food & beverages served with a welcoming smile. The dining room on level 3 was highlighted by the service given by Durga. Her friendly smile and service made our dinner even more enjoyable. Our room had everything we needed and was spotlessly clean. All staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly.

title: Not Bad
desc: When arriving at the hotel there was a problem with my reservation, that perhaps should of been sorted out between the hotel and the OTA, however the follow up from the hotel side to is to be commended. Rooms are clean and well equipped with a very large bathroom and great city views. Ordering room service was interesting, met with a lot of "yips" from the order taker and little if any information on the products available, upon delivery the food was dropped on a table still wrapped in plastic cling film - not quite what one would expect from this hotel. All up good business hotel.

title: As always...Fantastic!!!
desc: We booked this hotel a year ago and decided to stay here again this year for our yearly visit to Singapore. As always, we had a fantastic stay! One of the highlights was, before we even approach the reception this young lady out of nowhere recognize us and welcome us back again with such warm smile. Her name was Lea. She is very polite and hospitable. She gave us a good view room and no matter how busy she is she always smile and ask us how was our day. One of the reason why we chose this hotel besides the location are the amazing friendly people in it. Very real people with such warm service. A bit pricey but worth it. Rooms are big and well cleaned. Near to the city and MTR. Try the eating places outside the hotel. Hotel's breakfast not so much choices. Thanks you again

title: Staycation in the heart of Tangjong pagar
desc: Had a 2D1N at this amazing hotel which is located very near Tangjong Pagar mrt. For the price you pay, I'm sure this hotel won't disappoint you. Located very near to bars and some famous Korean restaurants, you will have the best choice of different types of variety of food to choose from. What's more, the breakfast buffet is simple yet very filling. They serve salmon too which is my favourite. My executive room is located on the 17th floor and the room is simply stunning. All I can say is, the room is very very clean and there's nothing you can describe this 4 hotel other than the word luxury. It felt like a 5 star hotel . I mean seriously :) It's simply a bliss to stay here even for a short while. I highly recommend you to stay here if you're looking for a good and well

title: Good for Staycation
desc: Did a 1 night stay over a weekend with a friend whom came to Singapore for Concert. The hotel is one of the newer ones in this area, room was nice and clean. Good location, 3 minutes walk to the Tanjong Pagar MRT Station. Near the Tanjong Pagar Road where you can still find food after midnight, excellent location for foodie... Check-in & Check-out was fast, but all comes with a Price Tag. Anyway, decent rooms in Singapore are not cheap.

title: Good!
desc: 5 mins walk from Tanjong Pagar Mrt station, near to many restaurants and there is a shopping mall just next to the hotel. Very good location. Check in process was simple and fast. Friendly staffs, clean and spacious room. It is value for money.

title: An excellent hotel, with great staff.
desc: Highly recommended as a stopover. Visited with my family and we enjoyed the bed size (king), the breakfast (continental with fusion of Asian and European) and the pool area. Concierge service was a big help to us as well. We had lost some luggage and they saved it for us.

title: Club room great value
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights from 17 August with friends. We booked a Club room which cost a little extra but well worth it. Included buffet breakfast with a cooked option available, complimentary buffet snacks and drinks from 6-8pm in the Club Lounge. Fantastic value. The lounge is on the 28th floor so views are great and the staff are excellent. Special mention of one particular staff member Shek Ezra... He is the epitome of excellent customer service - remembered our names after only one visit and went out of his way to ensure our comfort. Attentive without imposing and very professional. Top marks Shek. Another worth mentioning was Durga in the restaurant. Rooms were excellent. Allowed us late checkout and use of the pool and facilities until it was time to go to

title: Friendly and helpful staff!
desc: Spent an evening with a hotel guest and was immediately impressed with the courtesy and helpfulness of everyone we encountered -- from Taki in the lounge to Shek Erza (sorry if spelling is incorrect), I think he was at the Trading Floor, or the lounge for members, but he was simply amazingly accommodating without being intrusive! What a find. Food was good.

title: Very good stay
desc: Stayed here with family and it was quite nice. The room was good size, had a good restaurant and gym and close to chinatown. Also like a 5 minute walk from the MRT station so can easily go anywhere around singapore. Also opposite to a hawker center in case you get the munchies

title: Great Hotel and Excellent Service
desc: We stayed for 8 nights in a club room. The room was very spacious and clean. The service in this hotel is excellent and all the staff are amazingly friendly. The buffet breakfast has a huge variety with something for everyone. We would definitely stay here again.

title: A lot better....
desc: I use to stay here for every trip but stopped about a year ago as service and cleanliness had fallen off. I stayed again last week and the hotel had improved. Great service, clean and good rooms. Better then the red colored hotel across the street. Book the executive floor if you can. Worth the breakfast, free mini bar and evening buffet. Management has done a good job turning the hotel around. Well done!

title: Great room,excellent service, good location
desc: Carlton City Hotel was in a great location, opposite Tanjong Pagar food court, convenient store and market too. Service was excellent. Room was clean, bed was good, I got a connection room , so it's great. Got everything you need in the room. Free wifi and Free mobile phone for me to use while I was in Singapore, it's fantastic. Everything was great.

title: Lovely place to stay!
desc: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights recently and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Location wise, it is convenient and central. The Tanjong Pagar Plaza was just across the road and so was the Amara hotel with its adjoining shopping place. Lots of bars around too. There is a supermarket Fairprice, also just across the road and many small shops. It is close to Orchard Road, by cab. Hotel wise, I think is is fairly new as everything was spotless and really modern. Our room on the 17th floor had a nice view. The room was spacious, with a really nice bathroom that has a tub separate from the shower. Flatscreen tv showed a personalized welcome message which was rather sweet I thought. Bottled water were provided, as were coffee/tea making facilities. There was an iron, ironing

title: Thank you for surprised celebration ðŸ’—ðŸ’•
desc: I'm spending this hotel (11th September 2016)and today it's my birthday.suddenly hotels stuff visited my room with cute birthday cakes and birthday card, What's wonderful surprised.....!!!thank you soooo much! I'm unforgettable memories and birthday !!! Thank you so much

title: Birthday
desc: We recently stayed for 6 nights what a great place staff were so friendly nothing was to much trouble.room was clean with great views added bonus free mini bar and the breakfast provided a very good selection.finally I had my birthday on the 11th September 2016 and I was greeted with birthday cakes and a little card well done Carlton City what a great little added touch!

title: Cozy but not well-maintained
desc: The location is good, service is ok, and the room is cozy. However, many equipments in the room are not well-maintained. I would probably try another hotel should I have chance to travel in Singapore next time.

title: Great value
desc: We stayed for 9 nights during the F1 Grand Prix and the hotel was hard to fault. Room was a good size with a great bathroom. The free minibar was an unexpected bonus. The staff were friendly and the hotel manager even farewelled us. The only negative was the internet based TV, which unfortunately was not up to standard, however we were told that it was due to be replaced next month (However I am not sure that choosing a hotel based on the TV coverage would be a good idea anyway). Overall great value for money.

title: Ticked all the boxes!
desc: Just stayed 3 nights at this hotel on a business trip and I had a great stay. The location is so convenient within the financial district, with many conveniences within walking distance. The hotel feels new and modern. Even if this may not be a luxury hotel, all the necessary amenities are available to make for a comfortable stay. Unlike many other hotels I'd stayed in, I also loved that the shower tap and temperature knobs are separate, so you just need to tune the water temperature once and it stays the same throughout your stay. The service staff throughout the hotel were courteous and helpful, and were able to address me by name on the 2nd day onwards, which is saying something. I also had evening drinks at their rooftop Graffiti bar and it was a very nice experience.

title: Grand Prix week
desc: We stayed here for 5 nights during the Grand Prix, very good value for money, breakfast was excellent and kept us full till mid afternoon. The staff were very friendly and knowledgable. Only drawback was that just inside the room were a number of switches... One of these was to let the cleaner know to do our room! We were not told about this and do the first day we didn't have our room cleaned or any clean towels! ðŸ˜¡ Apart from the above the beds were comfortable and the room was a decent size.

title: Does all the essentials well
desc: This is a very good hotel without being over the top. Checkin is efficient, the room well appointed, a good rooftop bar and adequate breakfast. Response to a couple of maintenance issues was excellent when my power board tripped the room power and the attendance to a slow draining shower. All aspects of the room were excellent with well located power points, labeled light switches, very good bathroom with bath and shower, quiet a/c and a spacious style to the room. Wifi was free, easy to connect, good speed and able to support multiple devices and remained continuously accessible for the duration of my stay. Breakfast was pretty standard. All in all, I would recommend and return.

title: A Superb Hotel
desc: The location is perfect, you can see it right away when you exit from the Tanjong Pagar MRT station, even in the night, quite easy even for the first-comer to Singapore. My room was large and clean, and everyday their staff would tidy up my room, get my stuffs organized, I felt quite good when I saw everything in order when I came back everyday. No extrodinary views from the windows, only countless buildings, anyway, it doesnt matter too much to me. Breakfast is OK, you may check them from the photos uploaded, not much surprise but not too shabby, you may fill up your stomach here before having fun or doing business. I recommend the sausages, that tastes great. Speaking of facilities, I'd love to highlight the swimming pool, which is right next to the Plate restaurant. The

title: Ideal location brilliant staff
desc: We stayed here for a few days during our honeymoon and I can't fault it. The location is ideal to travel around the main spots in Singapore, brilliant restaurant, lovely rooms and the staff are very attentive.

title: Nice Staff , location OK
desc: I've been to Singapore for participating the WTA finals in Oct 16 , and the travel agent recommended me this hotel. Some points to say: 1. Room size is just ok, for 2 people is OK, but not recommended for those have kid. 2. Nice staff at the front desk, very helpful when we ask about the transport. 3. The buffet Breakfast in the hotel can be better. The variety of food is not enough. I'll give a B grade for it. 4. There is a local supermarket very close to Carlton City Hotel, which is quite good for buying souvenir / snacks. 5. The location of hotel is close to MTR. 6. The bed is comfortable.

title: One of the best hotel I ever stayed at!!!
desc: I have traveled to many countries and stayed at a lot of hotels and this was one of the best experience I've ever had. I went to Sg before heading to the Philippines and went back after for few days before heading home. For the second time I had already booked at a different hotel as I wanted to stay in a different neighbourhood (and really regretted it). The service here was out of this world! Everyone, I mean EVERYONE at the hotel goes out of their way to ensure that you have the best stay possible. The rooms are clean, comfortable and big (in SG standards). Location is perfect close to everything. Getting around in SG is the easier of any other city and there an MRT next to the hotel. I will never stay anywhere else when travelling to SG and STRONGLY recommend it to everyone!

title: Great loction
desc: great stay with good view and surprisingly well situated for sight seeing stayed on 19th floor with spectacular views over the ocean room big and bed comfortable iphone available if needed staff fiendly pool 'cold' but ok outside breakfast was ok a bit disorganised , slow to clear tables and wet floor signs on display

title: Value for your spend
desc: We stayed for a week. Room was lovely. What I liked the most was that the guest are provided handy phones for use within city limits duirng the stay. This was really beneficial and avoids the need for using local calling/data cards.

title: a cool contemporary space in the local neighbourhood
desc: I love exploring Singapore neighbourhood cause it gives me the sense of what Singapore truly is. Don't get me wrong, the main tourist attraction like Orchard and Marina Bay is always great, but after a while, you might want to shift from the touristy places to somewhere that feels more local. I was so glad to find the Carlton City Hotel in one of the most iconic neighbourhood, Tanjong Pagar (in between Chinatown and Raffless CBD). The area is rapidly developing indeed, since there are more and more branded hotels in the vicinity. This thoughtfully designed, 386-room hotel is filled with a monochromatic gradient with a combination of wooden and steel elements in the furniture. The hotel is also equipped with swimming pool, gym, and meeting facilities. Several notable things in

title: Good Location, Friendly Staff
desc: The location is good as it is at Tanjong Pagar and it is literally a few steps from the Train Station and from the train, it's a few stops away from town. Breakfast service was good and i heard they recently have a 1-for-1 buffet and it was very affordable. The staff is on point and will always clean up your room and people are always willing to help you

title: Very good location
desc: Central location with great access to most places in the city. Excellent friendly staff although check in took about an hour because of a big group checking in. The rooms were clean and breakfast was good. Taxis are easily available close by and the concierge are very friendly and always helpful

title: Toprated
desc: Especially the service in the Carlton City Club Lounge provided by our waiter Shek Ezra was excellent. Very friendly and personal service. The breakfast and food in the lounge was very nice (delicious) and the atmosphere is very good.

title: horrible stay
desc: First time staying here out of the many times in Singapore. Will NEVER stay here again! Rooms are damp and mouldy. Bathroom walls stained, toilet flush did not work. When I provided feedback, all they could tell me was sorry but we do not have any other rooms! Just what we needed to ruin our vacation!

title: nice hotel
desc: nice location (closed to Chinatown and MRT station). Clean and decent room. The complimentary smartphone comes really handy, it provided me with complimentary local calls and internet data and saved me a some headache of getting a local sim card.

title: Fantastic Hotel
desc: Without a doubt one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Rooms are beautiful, clean and good size, pool and gym area are great and a beautiful sitting area round the pool also. The staff are fantastic, friendly, very polite and so super helpful, they could not do enough for us. The location is perfect, is a hop, skip and a jump away from the Tanjong Pagar MRT station and malls across the road from it. We had breakfast every morning, breakfast was beautiful and fresh, fantastic price (especially for Singapore) and the staff were amazing. This will definitely be our go to accommodation when in Singapore in the future

title: Very impressed
desc: Fabulous hotel in an excellent quiet location. Beautifully appointed rooms with magnificent city views. Very happy with the pool area. The Concierge was excellent as was the doorman. Outstanding service. Would definitely recomend.

title: Great hotel. Clean, comfortable, modern, quiet. Everything a business traveller needs.
desc: Second time staying at this hotel. I have nothing but good things to say about it. The staff are polite and helpful, the location is great, with very easy access to Tanjong Pagar MRT and plenty of taxis outside. The supermarket opposite is open 24 hours and has lots of great stuff. The plate restaurant downstairs offers a hge selection of food and the breakfasts are catered to every taste (European/American/Asian). My room (1618) was always made up on arrival, the bedding was superb and I was very comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and the in room facilities were all great too (iron, ironing board, hairdryer, coffee/tea, cups, minibar fridge, desk, phone, mobile phone (free to use), TV, air conditioning, wardrobe with robe, slippers, safe. The windows are large and

title: Great hotel to stay in Singapore
desc: My husband & I are very happy to stay at this hotel for 8 nights. Good location: near MRT station (Tanjong Pagar) which is close by to Marina Bay Sands, Gardens By The Bay & approximately 8 minutes walk to the China Town. We also traveled by taxi to various places with very reasonable fares. The room was very clean. The bed & pillows were very comfy. Nice size bathroom with separate shower & bath tub. The white towels were soft & fluffy. Friendly staff & amazing service. Average size swimming pool & small gym. We will definitely recommend & return to this hotel in the future.

title: Solid, efficient, modern business hotel
desc: It's not the best hotel by far. But it is modern, slick and a good location. The room was a good size, with everything you'd expect from a business hotel. Common areas were nice, and the cafes and bars are also very good. It's less than $200 it is excellent value, which is why I would recommend this hotel and the reason for the 5 stars.

title: Outstanding hotel & best customer service
desc: Brilliant hotel, great location, and the best customer service I ever received in any hotel ever. From the moment me and my husband arrived, to the day we left, I couldn't believe the level of service we received and got me thinking - why other hotels can't be the same..it should be standard. Anyway, we booked through a third party website and got great discount and got a deluxe room. We didn't choose to upgrade as we didn't think it was worth it. To upgrade to an Executive room, you can top up additional $25++ per night or to Club room at $65++ per night. But for what you get for it, we didn't think it was a good offer? Even though other reviewers seem to think differently. We preferred to walk around the city and eat out than be stuck in the hotel eating the same food over

title: A nice pleasant stay
desc: We have just stayed 4 nights at the hotel. Check in was fine, smooth and quick. Room had a king size bed, bath and shower. Flat screen Tv as well. Free wifi all over the hotel which we found was quick and no issues at all. The rooftop bar was a nice place to wind down in the evening. Nearest MRT station was less than 5 minutes away. While you are staying there, the hotel supplies you with a mobile phone which has maps pre loaded on it so you don't need to carry round tourist maps. You can also make free international calls with it as well. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again, and would like to thank the staff for their friendliness and service during our stay.

title: Wonderful place
desc: Had one night here in a club room and enjoyed our stay. Room was well appointed and bed very comfortable. Location was good for shopping and restaurants and only a $7.00 taxi ride to the Marina Bay Cruise ship terminal where we boarded our ship. Staff were professional and very friendly. Will definitely stay here on our next trip to Singapore.

title: value for money
desc: Location is near the business district and convenience to business travellers. The MRT is just cross the street at the back of the hotel, not more than 3-5 mins walk. The famous Maxwell Food Centre is within 10 mins easy walking distance. There are also many other eating places closely nearby. The NTUC, local supermarket and many fruit stalls is right opposite the hotel. The lobby and the front staff are good. In the room, we found that the bathtub and the sealant in the shower glass panels had black mould which required to be cleaned. The auto switch of the electric kettle is not working and the water kept boiling. This is dangerous. Overall, it is reasonable for the price charged and can be improved if the housekeeping is supervised better.

title: Great time in Singapore
desc: I was so contemplating changing my hotel to stay at Marina Bay sands but I'm glad I didn't. Carlton city was an ideal hotel LOCATION Close walking distance to Chinatown, about 5 min. 2 minute walk to a metro stop. We found we walked quite a bit so waking back from the marina may have taken about 25minutes but it wasn't too bad. Singapore is quite flat so it's easy you walk around. It has a hawker market close by along with a supermarket across the road. Plus plenty of other bars and restaurants. ROOM Great room, large bathroom. Had complimentary drinks in the fridge which was great. Plenty of space. Air conditioning worked well considering the humidity outside. Took a while for the clothes to dry that I had hand washed. I can't fault anything with the room. Free Wi-Fi. And

title: Great hotel
desc: Stayed for a week for a holiday. Great location near Tanjong Pagar MRT station, a Fairprice 24 supermarket across the road, 5 to 10 walk to Chinatown and plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. Stayed in a deluxe room with kingside bed. Good sized room and bathroom, great bath with large window to the room. Nicely appointed for a standard room. Staff were really attentive and helpful. I had a broken TV, with a minor problem with the screen shortly after checking in. After a call to reception, a technical person came and 15 minutes later a new TV was installed, with no fuss and no more troubles. The Graffiti bar was really nice on the 29 floor. I never tried the Plate restaurant opting to eat elsewhere. There's plenty of choice around the hotel. I would easily

title: Good location
desc: Great hotel with nice rooms The hotel location is excellent walking distance to almost everything u want. Starbucks is two blocks away as well as shopping, hop on hop off bus goes by if u want to do that tour. Keep in mind the cost are high in Singapore if u book room look at room with breakfast included. If u only want small breakfast Macdonald is less than one block behind Room are modern with Wifi in rooms .

title: Comfy bed, nice location
desc: The location is in the city and a subway station is in a short walk distance. The room is clean, bed is comfy. Service is average for this hotel class. There is a supermarket opposite the hotel where you can buy fresh fruit and local food at the hawker near by. The rooftop bar is a good place to relax and have a sip of cocktail. View was not the best over looking the moving containers harbor.

title: Love the room!
desc: Booked this room for 1 night as a staycation. Overall, this is a value for money. My room had the sea view of PSA area. But it's fine. I enjoyed my stay here. Room is spacious and clean. The bathroom has a see-through glass that comes with a separate shower and bathtub which is awesome! The channels available on the tv are plenty! The wifi is also great! Would definitely book again.

title: Big Room and Excelent Club Lounge
desc: This hotel is near everywhere, friendly stuff, good food, and also very recommend to take the club room. The club lounge was amazing with many variant canapes and wine. its totally 5 star style. Excellent walking distance to china town for see the other side for shopping. I stay there when My birthday and the stuff bring the cake for the compliment thank you so much.

title: A little disapointed
desc: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of September and were very pleased with the room and services provided by the hotel. Breakfast was well worth it. However, on our return for a night on our way home, we were allocated a disabled person room. This room only had a hand held shower over a bath with a very wide edge to negotiate your way into the bath and was very hard to use. My wife still has the bruise on the inner knee to prove it. Water went everywhere including the blind on the inside of the adjoining glass partition. We would have understood if reception had told us the room was set up for disabled people, but they did not inform us to give us a choice. Probably would have accepted the room if it were offered in the first place.

title: Business and Vacation what a lovely place to be!!
desc: We stayed here for 10 nights and its a very accessible hotel the restaurants and laundry coin place , and market and MRT is super near you can even walk :) and across the hotel is a fruit stores and a grocery its amazing!! the room have a nice view to their big huge harbor :) seeing huge ships with a lot of cargos which needs to be deliver to other far away countries.I love Singapore tunnels it's awesome!!!

title: Ideal Location
desc: We stayed at Carlton City as part of our honeymoon. The hotel is perfectly located in Tanjong Pagar, 1 minute to the MRT, 10 minutes to Chinatown. The hotel is modern and cleanly furnished and the rooms are well appointed. The staff are helpful and polite. A bonus was the in room smart phone available for use in and around Singapore. This greatly helped us as we could access maps and the internet while out and not have to rely on a public wifi hot spot. The breakfast is simple but there is enough choice. The hotel seems to be aimed at business people and we felt we might have been one of the few leisure travellers staying at Carlton City. If you need a centrally located hotel in Singapore, Carlton City is an ideal choice. Easy access to everything you need, would definitely

title: Excellent Hotel
desc: Just spent a fantastic three nights at the Carlton City Hotel, Singapore. The staff were amazing, friendly, helpful and warm. Arriving at the hotel from the UK very early morning (0930) I was expecting to be told that check in would not be available due to rooms not being ready etc, this was not the case. Kesavan on reception greeted me with a warm smile and not only assured me he would allocate me a room immediately but also gave me a choice of floors! All the staff here are professional, polite and happy from the guys on concierge (Raj and Ali to name only two) who made me feel welcome and shared a joke with me to the girls at the patisserie all have excellent customer service levels. The hotel itself is exceptionally clean and is well situated for getting around Singapore

title: Quite disappointing
desc: When checking-in the credit card was declined. Staff not friendly at all. After withdrawing cash, they did not show any helpful attitude in spite of the unease. Bedsheet dirty. TV channels not working. Yellow spots on the floor of the bathroom. Wifi working alternatively. Poor breakfast. Quite an horrible experience. A special mention for the gentleman at the reception: Arif or similar name. Horrible attitude towards clients!!! Not helpful at all. Not suitable to manage with customers (I do an average of 3 flights/week all over Asia and never seen such a bad attitude towards clients)

title: Almost perfect.
desc: From the pictures online, this hotel didn't particularly give me much of an impression but checking in, everything almost exceeded my expectations. The beds in particular were wonderfully comfortable, with some of the softest and most silky smooth sheets I have ever seen in a hotel (even better than many luxury ones). In fact, it was so comfortable i had trouble getting up or even wanting to go out to do anything. Haha. Location was also great, with shops and food all around and an MRT just round the corner :) The toilets were gorgeous as well with really clean clear glass looking into the bedroom, giving it a much larger appearance. However, I wished there was a hand bidet with the toilet as I think its something quite essential in this time and age. I also don't know why the

title: Even better than last time
desc: We had stayed at the Carlton City Hotel two years ago and liked it very much so of course came back before leaving on a cruise this October and on our way back in November. What can I say? The hotel has become even better than last time. Wonderful staff that goes out of their way to be helpful. We felt so pampered! After a little hickup Carlton's charming front office manager Shaari Jamal upgraded us to club class on our way back which means a room on one of the upepr floors with great views over Singapore and access to the complimentary Club Lounge where Shek Ezra spoiled us with his very attentive service. We had a fabulous stay and recommend Carlton City Hotel Singapore again wholeheartedly!

title: My favorite place to stay in Singapore
desc: Looking for THE great place to stay in Singapore? Singapore Carlton City Hotel our absolutely favorite. Very nice hotel, real great people and every time helpful. And by the way. It's just about 500m away from the famous Chinatown. Thanks for staying there.

title: Good Location
desc: The location is good that easy to get food and stuff, also the China Town and Maxwell Food Centre. The rooms are clean and I love the comfortable pillow the most. The shower gel and shampoo refill everyday. The reception staff were nice and the process is quick and clear. Most thanks for the Duty Managers nice and patient.

title: Poor customer service
desc: The hotel is quite nice, but their customer service at the check in desk is terrible for a five star hotel. It took an hour to check in when we made reservations well ahead of our trip. Very unpleasant staff who didn't even address us with our names or acknowledge us. Just took our documents, didn't say a word and were reluctant to answer our questions. We booked three rooms and well in advance, asked for extra bedding in one of our rooms to accommodate three people. We waited an hour to finally be checked in, proceeded to our rooms only to find that they all had one bed in it. Went back downstairs to be told that they will give us the bed after we checked in. Maybe we should have known this, but this should have been communicated to us regardless. Aside from their one word

title: Great staff, wonderful hotel, great location
desc: I had a great time at the Carlton City. The location is perfect (close to chinatown and MRT), the hotel is wonderful and most of all they have great staff. They were always very polite, helpful and ready to organize everything for us. I noticed at the airport (on my way back home), that I had forgotten my wallet in the safe. There was no time to go back and get it, so I gave the reception a call and they sent it to the airport by taxi. 30 minutes later the taxi arrived at the airport and gave it to me. Needless to say that there was nothing missing. Thanks again!!!

title: Nice hotel and very polite and friendly stuff!
desc: Due to business trips I came here a couple of times and I always felt welcome! The stuff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are big and well equipped. I also like the location, a lot of places are in walking distance.

title: Amazing hotel, staff and service
desc: On arrival (exhausted uncomfortable flight with Jetstar - never again) we were met by Gilbert. This gentleman with professionalism and ease booked us into our room, provided helpful information regarding the hotel facilities and the surrounds. We were enlightened by his lovely manner. For our 3 night/4 day stay we chose a clubroom. Best thing! Worth all the money. Breakfast, hors d'oeuvres, drinks, 2 free laundry pieces, free mini bar not to mention a complimentary smartphone to use during our stay. Panjong Pagar MRT 2-5 walk, supermarket, shops, restaurants all close by in this quite area. Roof top bar with amazing view of harbour. Thank you to Shek in the Club Lounge for your very caring manner, you always ensured the best of best service when we visited (and yes your

title: Excellent hotel in Singapore
desc: I stayed one night for business: the hotel is really comfortable, professional reception and friendly staff. Very large rooms with a beautifull bathroom. Complete and good continental breakfast. Easy to reach from the airport and very central in town.

title: High ceiling rooms with amazing views
desc: Our room was really clean and spacious. The staff were nice and the best part was the great view from our window. The restaurant also seemed nice with good offers, but we didn't try it because they only had buffet that night (even though the menu in the room said otherwise).

title: Ok, but not exceptional.
desc: City Carlton Hotel For the price of this hotel, I was at least expecting it to be spotless. The desk was sticky probably from spilt soft drink or fruit from the previous customer, hence not cleaned! The air con was far too cold, especially in the lobby, it is like a shock to the system when you come from the outside heat. The room air con was not really controllable, so we turned it off, but cool air was still coming through, but it was better. On a positive note, the staff were very nice and helpful. Worthwhile if the hotel has a special deal. Would not pay the full price for it. 5 minutes walk from Tanjong Pagar metro station. Very good Belgium bakery in the station. Not to be missed. Hotel bakery was too expensive. Overall it was good stay.

title: Great location, pleasant hotel
desc: Location was excellent - next to the metro, a hawker centre and a supermarket. Rooms were clean and the receptionists were very helpful, helping with an airline checkin and printing off boarding passes for us. One of our children had a birthday during our stay and a small gift appeared in our room that day. The children loved the pool too. We had 2 interconnecting rooms for 5 people and this worked well.

title: The Trading Floor
desc: I was in town with a friend and we decided to drop in somewhere for a coffee. We chose The Trading Floor literally by accident. The comfortable atmosphere is excellent for a relaxed afternoon chat - or a business meeting, a few of which I witnessed going on. Prices are absolutely okay, you will pay the same for a quality drink elsewhere. I would like to point out here how impressed I was with Durga's service. She had a genuine smile on her face, was very attentive and proactive. When we ordered a coffee she recommended the coffee from the cafe (another outlet) for its better quality, and had it sent over all the way from there.

title: Great Hotel
desc: Everything about this hotel is wonderful from check in to check out the staff are fantastic and very very friendly. Our flight was early evening so they let us stay in the room until 4pm unheard of in Australia,plus they give you a phone to use whilst staying at the hotel. If your looking for a place to stay in Singapore this is it 10/10 also the mini bar was free no spirits but who cares.

title: Central and nice
desc: Very good hotel.Good value for money. Nice shops restaurants and food courts very near to the hotel.Singapore is so nice and staying at this hotel make my visit successful. Highly recommended for couples and families

title: Sightseeing base
desc: We stayed for three nights as a stop over on our way to New Zealand and had chosen this hotel as it was reasonably priced and close to the city. Travel to the hotel was cheap and easy using the MRT system which starts in the airport and takes you to Tanjong Pagar MRT station just a couple of minutes away from the hotel. The room was modern and very comfortable with very attentive and helpful staff. We did eat in one night and found that that the restaurant had a good range of food to suit European tastes. Walking distance to Chinatown and very easy to visit all the other sights using the MRT (a 48 hour tourist pass is very cheap). Overall, pleased with our choice of hotel and would stay there again.

title: Wonderful Hotel
desc: This hotel is wonderful.... Staff are lovely and could not do enough for you, very helpful. Be careful though when booking as this is the sister hotel to The Carlton near Raffles, both are very nice and would recommend both to anyone wanting to come to Singapore. They also sent us complementary bear and sweets with wine as it was a Special occasion. Thank you Carlton City.

title: Total experience makes it 4 stars
desc: Definitely not a 5 star hotel. A strong 3 closer to 4 stars. I understand the hotel is 3 years old. Breakfast at the 28th floor quiet with better ambiance than the 3rd floor. The room I stayed in at the 10th floor had a comfortable kingsize bed. The bathroom amenities are basic and its quality average. Concierge service is excellent, very helpful and you can feel their desire to make your experience e.g making restaurant reservation and suggestions, arranging transportation and giving directions as pleasant as possible. It's approximately 15 mins by taxi to Takashimaya in Orchard Rd. And you will need transportation or take the underground train to go most anywhere however If you have business near china town stay here but if with family on leisure or vacationing, sightseeing

title: Lovely hotel
desc: Good location near transport & shops & restaurants, maxwell hawker food stall centre nearby, amazing dj bakery opposite, modern & large room, clean, comfortable bed, good bath & shower facilities, nice swimming pool with free towels, helpful & friendly staff, gym with free water bottles. Free use of smartphone, handy for use throughout your stay.

title: Good Business hotel in City Center
desc: Stayed here during my business visit to Singapore. Beautiful hotel with all modern amenities. I was pleasantly surprised to see a free smart phone for use during the period stay. It was so convenient for data use and city navigation. Excellent breakfast spread. You will not be disappointed. One small discomfort was on room Temperature. Except on and off, controller doesn't seem to work. Room was bit cold.

title: Good choice
desc: Very good location!Supermarket just behind to the hotel.Closed to MRT.Easy to access to the scenic points such as China Town,Orchard Road,Raffles Place,City Hall....... Good breakfast,clean blanket,free cell phone...... Will come back again!

title: Fantastic hotel!
desc: Getting straight to it, the hotels in a good location very close to the MTR line which as an added bonus is the same line as the airport (for minimum messing around after a long trip) The lobby is huge and looks great, checked in without any queue at all, and around about 2pm too. I was on the 8th floor, upon entering the room, the weight of the door already let's you know your going to like it. The room is great, a huge comfy bed, really high ceilings, big interactive television which welcomes you by name which is a nice touch. You also get the use of the 'Handy' smart phone, which is indeed handy...however I've stayed elsewhere that used the same system and allowed me to use the handy as a hotspot for my actual smart phone, the one at Carlton didn't.. but I'm 99% sure it's

title: Excellent city centre base!
desc: I stayed here for three weeks in December on business and the staff could not have done more to make my stay comfortable and enjoyable! Lovely room, great pool, everyone is very friendly. Great breakfasts in Plate on the 3rd floor - pretty much anything anyone would want was available at the buffet, hot and cold. Also free excellent wifi. Its location in Tanjong Pagar is also super convenient for the MRT five mins walk away and there is a bus stop right outside. Chinatown is a 10 minute walk and you can easily spend a whole day there marvelling at the vibrant market atmosphere, the food and the bright colours! Also across the road is a FairPrice supermarket and lots of ATMs. I loved it - so much that I am returning to the Carlton City in January! Five stars!

title: Great location, spacious rooms!
desc: Two minutes ftom MRT station with easy connection to Changi airport. Lots of local restaurants in the area and a 24 hour supermarket across the road. Spacious room with good bed, although housekeeping can definitely be improved. Surprised to find a threadbare towel with a hole one day , really should have been thrown out. Then no foot towel in bathroom another day which was actually dangerous for a marble bathroom floor especially when wet.

title: Excellent
desc: Top quality at all rooms. Used a standard room and a suite. Service of top quality and all amenities were available. Obviously the suite was on a class of its own. I was upgraded to suite and was pleasantly surprised. Spent total of 4 days (5, 8-10 Dec). Breakfast very good with all options available. Only "complain" was the small gym!

title: Honeymoon Trip
desc: Room service is quite bad as it takes too long time in case if something is required since at times there is no staff to serve you. Also poor quality of call picking at reception as I have to walk down to reception once even.

title: Nice and Clean
desc: Felt very secured. The room is clean and very relaxing. Wifi is available, location is good also as restaurants and malls are accessible. Amenities include slippers, robes, pen and papers., toiletries, and blower. No bath tub only shower and No breakfast buffet also.

title: Always happy to stay here
desc: The hotel is new and clean. Hotel staff are helpful. Nice rooftop bar with happy hours. 24h supermarket located opposite. Try the maxwell foodcourt nearby and get your singapore chicken rice at the stall called tian tian. you will see the line. must be one of the best chicken rices in singapore.

title: Nice stay except the reception rarely picks up the phone
desc: We stayed at the Carlton City Hotel for 4 nights. The room was quite comfortable and the location is near numerous restaurants. My only complaint is that the reception rarely picks up the phone. I need to call at least 2 times for them to pick up the phone.

title: Great location and friendly staff.
desc: On our arrival at the Carlton City Hotel at 02:00 am, we were warmly welcomed by the front desk staff who swiftly assisted us with our check-in and luggage. The hotel foyer was bright, clean and well decorated for the festive season with a great big Christmas tree. The two connecting rooms that we booked were very comfortable.
