The water pressure in the shower was excellent and the bathroom amenities were plentiful. A bigger bar fridge and a small microwave added to this room would have been a bonus. But no real complaints. In addition, we were provided 2 complimentary bottles of water daily. On Christmas Day, each room also received a gingerbread cookie gift and card. This was the perfect hotel to stay in Singapore. We were located 15 mins walking distance from Chinatown. Here,

title: Great Location, Price and Comfort
desc: We stayed here on our first trip to Singapore. PROS: - Location was great. Singapore is fairly small and the location of this hotel was excellent. There is a mall and hawker center right across the street with a supermarket and fresh fruit stands. It's on a main street that leads straight to the Maxwell Center (big hawker center, ~5 min. walk), China Town (~10 min. walk), Clark Quay (~15 min. walk), River Quay/Boat Quay and Merlion (~15 min. walk). The bus stop is across the street as well. - A feature of the hotel that was incredibly helpful and convenient is the smart phone they include in the room at no charge. You can take the phone with you as you explore Singapore. The phone is pre-loaded with information on Singapore activities, guides, ticket discounts, maps, etc.

title: Very good service and grear location
desc: Very good hotel especially feel greatful and helpful will "Handy" device to let us enjoy free internet, free calls, cheap tickets. Staff is friendly, service is good. highly recommended. It situated 5 mins walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT and surrounded with great location for food. Will return next time.

title: Perfect
desc: Great Hotel in the middle from Singapore Super nice service wounderful club lounge. Nice swimmingpool for a short rest from shopping and a GYM very clean. Had a club room wich had a great few and it was very clean. Breakfast is also great. Would get back again.

title: Useful handy
desc: Stayed seven nights during Christmas, chose non-breakfast package. Close to Chinatown and Maxwell Food Centre, more food choices when street shops open after 11am or 12, before 10 am, not much choice. Close to MRT, 2-minutes walk. Hotel staff ok, not very warm. Cleaning not the best, in one day forgot the slippers and the other day the hand towel had a hole. But the handy offered for free by hotel was very helpful to buy tickets at discount and to know where to visit.

title: Comfortable Stay
desc: I stayed in Jan 17 for 3 nights in this hotel. I would really want to than the bartender in cafe situated in Lobby for his help. I had a Sore throat and he prepared nice hot tea with honey and served. Very thoughtful. The hotel is in commercial area and quite dry place but you get some Pubs / Bars within 15 minutes walk. The room was comfortable and clean.

title: Brilliant
desc: Stayed for 2 nights. Lovely hotel at such a cheap price. Gorgeous modern room with lovely view on the 12 th floor. Comfiest bed ever , very modern room. Service was great arrived after early flight and an early check in at 11 was no problem. Good location - 5 mins from hawker food stalls and China town. 25 min walk from marina sands prom. Tried pool and gym which were both great. Room only so can't comment on food. Recommend for Singapore on a budget as the same hotel in London would be Â£250 a night definitely!

title: Very comfortable
desc: Stayed here for a few days for business and was very happy with it. The staff is really helpful and the location is nearly ideal (close to China Town, MANY restaurants and bars nearby, close to city centre). Rooms work well and the wifi is also decent. The rooftop bar is nice and easy, but there are also many nice ones around the corner.

title: Everything about this place is perfect
desc: Seriously, everything about this hotel is perfect. The hotel is conveniently located near local food stalls, stores and marts. The room itself is clean and the high floor to ceiling space makes gets rid of feeling of being â€˜enclosedâ€™. The hotel consists of a lovely buffet, rooftop bar, rooftop pool and a gym which is quite useful. My partner and I love this place so much that we have booked this place again at the end of this month for the first leg of our holiday! I would definitely recommend

title: Great choice
desc: This hotel is located downtown and only a 5-10 min walk from Chinatown. The nearest MRT is Tanjong Pagar and is only a very short walk away. It is also the same train line as the airport which is handy. The rooms were nice with all the usual amenities, including hairdryer, toothbrushes and a universal power point. The graffiti bar is worth a visit for a drink with a view and if you are a light sleeper I would ask for a room above level 4 and away from the lift as you can hear the pool below and the lift bings. I would stay here again, a nice hotel and a good location.

title: A very nice place to relax and ejjoy Singapore
desc: We just spent 3 nights at the Carlton City in an executive level room on the 24th floor. We used the Club Lounge for Breakfast and for evening drinks and snacks before venturing out to explore. The service at the hotel was very good and the staff friendly and very accommodating - nothing seemed to be a problem. We did have an issue one evening with poor service which I outlined in a quick email to the hotel - the reaction was the most professional I have ever experienced in all my years of travel - they absolutely value their customer - we were totally amazed. Would we stay here again, we certainly would and will if ever in Singapore again. The room was very comfortable and well laid out and whisper quiet - we slept like babies. They had a complimentary mobile smart phone in

title: Modern Hotel with great service
desc: I really enjoyed our stay at Carlton City hotel. Clean rooms & the equipments are very good and new. Breakfast at the club has been delicious and all of our needs are attended to quickly. The hotel is right by a 7-Eleven.

title: Couple getaway
desc: We recently stayed at Carlton City Hotel and were treated to great service by Shek Ezra. He looked after us in the Carton Club Lounge and went out of his way to give us a truly memorable experience. He was friendly, courteous and made our stay very enjoyable. The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming. The room was clean, bed comfortable. The bathroom had both shower and bath. Great area as close to transport facilities and Chinatown.

title: Great Bed, Great Location, Less than average service
desc: The location of this hotel is great, within very short distance to Chinatown and a couple of metro stations. The room is very nice, comfortable and roomy with a great view. They even have a free smartphone with internet to use while you stay there. Service, however, is less than average. Breakfast is close to being a nightmare. Tons of people, you have to share your table (nothing bad with meeting new friends but we were in our honeymoon). Lines for food are long and you have to settle for whats left.

title: An enjoyable first stay at this hotel
desc: We've previously tended to stay in Singapore hotels in the Marina Bay area but on this occasion tried somewhere new. It's very well situated for the train station (only 5 minutes away) and quite close to restaurants. It's also less than 10 minutes on foot from Chinatown which was particularly relevant as we arrived there (by chance) the day before Chinese New Year. Our room was a reasonable size and comfortable and, as we had a club room, we had access to the club area for drinks and canapes in the evening and breakfast each morning. We arrived from a flight fairly early in the morning but the staff were very obliging in allowing us access to our room early (and were also happy for us to use facilities such as the pool and club area prior to departing on an evening flight). It's

title: Singapore first night
desc: Great hotel ,modern ,fantastic room comfortable ,good breakfast and great view ,very central over loooking raffles ,best bed ever wish we had stayed longer would not hesitate to reccomend ,only problem was taxi wait

title: Amazing in every way
desc: What can i say. We got a really good deal on this hotel so we decided to stay there. The location was great - close to some great restaurants and the mrt is a short walk away. The rooms are clean and quite big. The staff are friendly and always willing to help you. We had a late flight so we left our bags with the porter for the day. The hotel offered a hospitality room for us that we booked in for 8pm. There was no extra charge but it was so great to shower and change before our long flight. We got to stay in there for 30mins per person. This is a service that is definitely helpful. Also the handy phones are great too. You get internet wherever you go and you can use the maps app to get around. Would definitely stay here again if i ever came back!!

title: A 'Pretty' but Ordinary Experience
desc: Relatively new hotel with room slightly bigger than their nearby competition. Amenities were fairly standard. However, a lot of minor issues popped up, and it added up, making people wonder whether it can be their preferred choice of hotel for their next trip. You have to push very hard towards the wall to make the front door locked. The armchair couch was a bit oversize and was blocking the way, really did not seem to fit in the room. TV channel selections were limited, or standard if you want to be diplomatic. Water pressure was extremely weak, and water temperature fairly unstable. Very slow water flow from the faucet. No electric socket in the bathroom which was quite inconvenient. For some reasons there was a sharp, stinky smell from the mini-fridge (room #902). I really

title: Good location but service is bad
desc: ir dryer in the room is not work. I asked room service to chang new one. We wait and keep asking counter to help about 30 mins. My wife's hair from wet until waiting to dry, one employee late to come up. He was not provide new one and just ask want to check hair dryer. After checked '' in the room'', and I keep asking to provide new one ,finally he was reluctant to change new one to us. Never see this room service in my life.And my wife got a cold after their rude treating.Bad experience!

title: Great Location
desc: The staff are amazingly kind and helpful - we received a lot of useful tourist advice during our stay. Hotel is contemporary but may be in need of a bit of a spruce up soon. We were disappointed by the signs of mould in the shower and the state of the carpet square in front of the lifts on ground floor. As a first impression, not 5 star oversight.

title: Wonderful Location close to all the restaurants you may need, shopping, MRT and sights
desc: I was extremely pleased with my choice of hotel for a 3 night stay. We had a wonderful big room with loads of space, and excellent bathroom facilities including new soft towels, toiletries, slippers, bathrobes etc. Staff were available if required, but otherwise kept a professional distance which is good if you like your privacy. The concierge was extremely helpful and offered great customer service. Loved the fact this hotel is a short walk to all the restaurants you would want, both hawker or high end, MRT, grocery shop and bakery across the road and very close to China town, Marina Bay area, etc. Only slight negative was the luke warm breakfast, but loads of choices so am really nit picking. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: Staycation thats value for money
desc: Stayed here for our anniversary. Opted a room with access to the lounge. Spacious room with bathtub and my son was relaxing in the tub watching tv. Time well spend with family, not too far away from home!

title: Pure Gold
desc: My wife and I stayed here for our Golden Wedding Anniversary. We could not have picked a better location or a better hotel and it made the occasion the most memorable ever. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The food was incredible and the room very comfortable. Situated on the edge of Chinatown the hotel is close to a couple of Hawker Food centres. In fact one is across the street. The food in these centres is cheap and very good and is the best way to learn which foods suit you. There are also many restaurants in the area. As far as exploring Singapore is concerned it could not have been easier from the hotel as it is only a 10 minute walk to an MRT subway station, The underground system is extensive and very easy and cheap to use. We explored many parts of Singapore

title: Club Room
desc: This was our first time at Carlton City. We go to Singapore most years for a week and have not stayed in this part of town before. The hotel is actually in a great location and a 2 min walk to MRT. There are shopping malls with supermarkets and a wet market opposite so a good mix of both. The hotel was excellent and our Club Room perfect. The club itself was well set out and comfortabl and had a variety of food each day for breakfast and cocktails. The service from Shek, Cherry, Atigah and Jackie was exceptional. They were all very efficient, polite and friendly and catered to all our needs. Shek organised out last day with a 3pm checkout which he managed to get extended to 5pm as the hospatility room was already booked - great effort. Carlton City should be proud of

title: Excellent Service!
desc: Travelled on business. The staff were very friendly and supportive (front desk, restaurant, etc. Rooms were clean and there was nothing to complaint about. Had only breakfast. the food was nice and had a variety. Restaurant staff (restaurant Plate) were very friendly too and also with my child. walking distance to China town, MRT and many outlets. Was a pleasant experience..

title: Great location and professional staff
desc: Luxury hotels are very expensive in Singapore and I was looking for a hotel under 250 Singapore Dollars a night. All the properties around Clarke Quay were more expensive, so I ended up booking the relativity new Carlton City Hotel. I didn't regret my decision. Although it is a twenty minute walk to the river, the location is excellent. And the walk through China Town to the river is pleasant with a lot of opportunities for eating and drinking along the route. The hawkers food courts on Maxwell and Smith Street are close by and shopping mails are just around the corner. After a long flight and the MTR ride (forty minutes with one change on the East-West line) from Changi Airport, I was greeted by very pleasant and professional staff. Check-inn was fast and efficient. The room

title: Awesome Stay
desc: I stayed in Carlton City Hotel for Business Trip and I must say that, the hotel is strategically located and service is awesome here. Being a Hotelier myself, I must say, that service in this hotel is really good and Associates are seen very happy working here. I rate this hotel to be one of the best service hotel in Singapore.

title: Great location downtown (small gym)
desc: Really enjoyed this hotel and it meets all expectations. Lounge is good to work from (few power sockets, good tables, great staff), but the gym is extremely small. The -1 is for the doorman breaking my suitcase handle when putting in the taxi for the airport (forced down the handle before clicking the release).

title: High quality hotel in good location
desc: I stayed at the Carlton City Hotel for business and it was ideal. The staff are friendly, the breakfasts are excellent and the pool is really nice. The gym, although small, is open 24 hours which is great for jet lag exercise. The rooms are comfortable and are only lacking English Breakfast tea!

title: Reasonable Hotel
desc: A reasonably priced hotel for Singapore. The rooms and facilities are all modern and very clean. The staff are super friendly and helpful. There were a couple of disappointments as the in-room dining is limited and average quality. The gym is small and cramped. Plus, whenever I used the iron it tripped the power in the room. However, I would still recommend this hotel if I needed to stay in that area in Singapore.

title: Very average
desc: Just one of those hotels that is forgettable. Nothing great and nothing truly awful but the "gym". The "gym" is a complete afterthought. A total of 5 piece of equipment plus some light free weights crammed into a room not much bigger than a closet. The treadmills are so old they still have connections to early generation iPods (not joking). Convenient yes. Forgettable definitely.

title: Horrifying Service and Management
desc: My flight to Singapore arrived at 1am (18 Feb) so I'm arriving the hotel at around 3am after getting some bites. Once we arrived at the lobby, the receptionist gave us the worst welcome ever- a stare and questioning whether we were supposed to arrive on 17th. I explained calmly and tiredly that my flight only arrived at 1am that's why I couldn't 'meet' the check-in time (which to be honest I'm never aware of a late check in policy in ANY hotel) and she only nodded without emotion. I didn't pay much attention as I thought she must be tired taking the night shift. On the second day, we left the room at around 11am without pressing the clean up room sign as I thought it's a normal procedure for any 4-star hotel to clean up with room daily. When we came back to get changed at

title: Worst Concierge in the world
desc: I've stayed at this hotel couple of times. I like the location and the room is good. Price is quite reasonable. However, on my last visit from 7-11 feb 2017, one of the concierge staff was really impolite and really make me mad. I was standing and lining up at the taxi stand, outside hotel lobby. Then this concierge guy came to me and ask whether I need a taxi, and I said yes. Then he told me that he will try to get a taxi a bunch of Japs with suits then will find one for me. Then I ask why, he said because these lads are staying guests. I told him that I stay at the hotel too. Then he said, it's because they told him first. Which is absurd. I got mad, i told him that if these people need a taxi, they need to line up like me. I don't care who they are, I'm a paying customer

title: Good location and live up to its standard
desc: I was there for 7 days and the room was clean, the staffs are nice and the location is great, just 5 min from Tanjong pagar MRT! The room is spacious and bathroom is always clean. Will definitely return to stay here.

title: Great Service and good value for a 5 Star
desc: Stayed at this hotel prior to and after taking a cruise from the nearby cruise port. Good on site restaurant, roof top bar and although small, adequate gym. About 20 minutes from the airport. Restaurant has a really awesome seafood/grill buffet on Saturday night. Not far from hop on hop off bus for sightseeing.

title: Brilliant Hotel
desc: My wife and I had the privilege of staying for Four days at the Carlton City Hotel Singapore in March 2017. The general manager Mr Ware and the concierge Assistant manager Nizar Ahamad and all there staff made our stay with them something special.The hotel is 2 years old. Our room on the 24th floor was spacious spotlessly clean,the food was excellent as was the bars, It has a nice swimming pool and a small gym but big enough for a 72 year old. We highly recommend it and it is in a great position for Sentosa Island and Marina Bay etc.

title: So and so.
desc: This hotel was nice but the staff is really cold. I sped there Dow nights and any time when i ask for some good restaurant every time they say me restaurant in hotel. The room was really old and not comfortable, the window was dirty.

title: Good Location, Better Service
desc: Good Location at Tanjong Pagar, 10mins MRT to Orchard Road Town. Breakfast at the hotel was awesome, met a very friendly staff. I believe his name is Faroq Evans, chat with him abit and he told me the places to visit etc. I seriously love this Hotel, I would recommend to those who wouldn't mind spending extra for a 5 star hotel.

title: Perfect location for work!
desc: Back to Singapore for a work trip over the weekend and Carlton City was a perfect location to work from as it was just across the road to where the event was being held. The room had a large view of the city and the bed/pillows were superbly comfortable. Just across the road you have options of local food at the hawker center or just a 10min walk to Maxwell Food center which has more options.

title: Good value for your money
desc: I picked this hotel because it was near an event that I had to attend. Overall, I was very satisfied with this hotel. My room was very clean and facilities were relatively new. The bed was very comfortable with quality, firm pillows. I dislike pillows that are lumpy or too soft. Wifi was free too. TV channel could be improved. Room service was efficient though the menu is quite limited. Nearby are numerous restaurants and excellent Japanese restaurants. Overall happy with my choice of hotel.

title: Club rooms are a must
desc: Stayed here for 5 nights in early March, we booked a club room and it was fabulous. Our room was on the 24th floor with views of the harbour. Check in was fast and efficient as was the service of the bell boys. We used the club room lounge for both breakfast and evening drinks and both were excellent for service and friendliness of staff. We used the pool once and that also was clean and well maintained. The use of the handy phone was very useful to us being our 1st time in Singapore and the 2 free laundry items per day was very useful. Overall a great stay with the MRT station only 5 mins walk and Chinatown the same. Fully recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Wonderful city fantastic hotel
desc: Visited Singapore this week and was very impressed by everything there. The hotel was great with friendly staff and great service. Shek in the lounge bar was a star, very professional with great knowledge.

title: Great location in Singapore
desc: We were here last week on our break journey vacation to Sydney ðŸ˜Š. This hotel has the best location close to Tanjong Pagar MRT and all the great eateries around. There is a super market right across the street on one side some great restaurants and coffee shops on the other. The room itself is average size but nothing to complain about. The people are nice, friendly and very helpful. We didn't get a chance to try the Graffiti roof top bar but it's on my list for next trip. The hotels location helps you get around easily and also track your way back in case you get lost! I'd definitely recommend it

title: Pleasant stay. Recommended
desc: Checked in for 2 nights and the deluxe room is really spacious. There even have a bathtub in it! Safe, in room slipper, hair dryer, Iron and Ironing board is in the room. Very good location, opposite of a 24 hours NTUC and many many eateries around the area. Near to Tanjong Pagar MRT which is about 5 mins walk. Around the same area has other hotels too such as Sofitel, Oasis, Armara Hotel and Orkid Hotel. Easy to access around with buses and taxi. The Tanjong Pagar hawker centre is right behind the hotel with many local food stalls. Right decision to stay here for sure!

title: Freindly staff and very good location
desc: Thank you to th Front Office Team for their kindness and their help. I asked to change the room, because I don't like to be next to the elevator. They immediatly took care of my demand and someone came up to bring me to a new room. Perfect location to get to all interesting points in the city. Just amazing, the smart phone in your room, that you can use during your stay! Great idea!

title: My favorite Singapore hotel
desc: Checking in at the Carlton City is like coming home. The first impression is always the large, very clean lobby with that charming subtle "Asian" scent and the very friendly staff at the reception desk. Rooms are quite spacious for Singapore and absolutely quiet. You really arrive at that place and relax. They offer a local mobile phone which I never used. Wifi is free and reasonably fast to work from the hotel room. The room service is excellent - try the Hokkien noodles or the Singapore Laksa. I personally don't like the breakfast buffet - just go across the street to buy fresh fruits or pastry from the locals. What I do recommend though is the rooftop bar - not very crowed, pretty casual with good beer and an nice view onto the container harbor.

title: Love it! Highly recommended.
desc: Stayed in 5 nights for a business trip. The room is spacious and hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is also very near to Tanjong Pagar MRT station, which makes travelling very convenient. Special thanks to Nizar from the concierge team for daily cheerful morning greetings and recommendations on places to visit :) Carlton will definitely be on top of my list whenever I'm visiting Singapore in future.

title: Good location and efficient service
desc: We stayed here for business last Feb 8-11, 2017. Check in was fast and efficient. All our request always came in less than 10 minutes. Rooms were clean, complete amenities and very good soundproofing . Breakfast was average . The Executive Lounge was quiet but elegant(we were the only guests in there). I would never hesitate to recommend this good hotel to business associates and friends if they visit Singapore.

title: Great place to stay
desc: Great location close to a metro station and easy walking distance to Marina Bay and Chinatown. Good quality hotel with friendly accommodating staff. Excellent quality rooms with a adequate third floor pool and excellent skybar.

title: Like it!
desc: Good functional place to stay Clean Good service Gym has good equip (although small and under equipped) Breakfast - good choice but a bit cafeteria Room service - efficient Beds - comfortable Very good business hotel. Wouldn't bring a hot date! If you're in town for business and the location works - thumbs up!!

title: Great hotel & perfect location
desc: We were staying in Singapore for 4 days pre cruise and after a lot of research decided on the Carlton City as our hotel base. I am pleased to say the choice could not have been better with a supermarket, MRT satiation and restaurants just a stones through from the hotel. Chinatown was a short walk and provided a multitude of cheap dinning options. The MRT system is probably the best in the world so accessing anywhere in Singapore was made very simple. The hotel staff were very pleasent and helpfull with any enquiries and the facilities were excellent. We arrived at 9 am after an overnight flight from the UK and were delighted to be told our room was available allowing us a couple of hours shut eye before embarking on our exploration of Singapore which is a wonderful city. The

title: We loved it
desc: We booked on the hotels web site and got a really excellent rate. We have been to Singapore several times before but have never stayed in this area. We found it ideal and really liked the area which is not touristy at all more for the locals with shopping, hawker centre and small supermarkets close by. A first time visitor to Singapore may prefer to be in the heart of say Orchard Road or the Quays. We arrived at Changi and for $2.50 singapore each we got the metro to Tanjong Pagar with one simple change at Tanah Merah, just walk across the platform. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the MRT (we timed it). We went in a side door of the hotel which was a bit difficult with our cases but we blundered through! The hotel lobby is light an airy and we were greeted very politely.

title: Amazing
desc: This was the first time I went to Singapore and I couldn't have had a better stay. The hotel was perfect and not expensive for a five star hotel. I stayed on the 11th floor and my room had one wall made of windows which gave me a good view on the other tall buildings around and a tiny bit of water I could see through the houses. There are several reasons why I loved this hotel so much: 1. The location - directly next to tanjong pagar station and a lot of stuff in walking distance. 2. The bed - was super comfy. 3. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Especially Kesevan at the concierge. He explained the whole city to me and gave me a lot of tips on what to do in the city. 4. The skybar - had such an amazing view. Of course it was a bit more on the expensive side like

title: Comfortable
desc: We recently stayed at Carlton city hotel .The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming.The room was clean,bed comfortable .The bathroom had both shower for bath.Great area as close to Chinatown and close to food market as well.

title: Awesome Hotel, loved it.
desc: The staff here are professional, friendly and very helpful. Travelling is difficult for me as I'm a Coeliac, however the food & beverage manager Kesh made sure that I had gluten free meals whenever we ate at the hotels restaurant called Plate. The meals were a la carte and just delicious. Kesh also spoke to the staff in their Club Lounge and arranged for me to have GF nibbles every afternoon. This made our trip to Singapore so much easier, enjoyable and stress free. Nothing was ever too much trouble, very well trained staff. The only negative thing I would have to say is that I had to chase up housekeeping as they sometimes didn't clean the rooms until lunchtime or later. Despite that we just 100% enjoyed our stay at Carlton City Hotel, we will,defiantly be back.

title: Good Value
desc: overall good hotel, some aspects of the room looks a bit tired , perhaps ned a bit of revamp the Free mobile phone available for you stay duration is excellent idea, and a great plus point if you are from overseas like me Cable tV poor choice channels could be better,

title: first stay in this part of Singapore... and this hotel
desc: I was a little skeptical as Tanjong Pagar used to be at the end of the city... and almost nothing was happening there. Somehow, I missed the fact that they have developed a bunch of new hotels, which are serviced by a whole host of newish restaurants and bars etc. The subway (MRT) is a quick stroll (say 3-4mins) and you can get to the Raffles Place in one stop. The hotel itself is neat, clean and quiet. In fact it's so quiet - I swear I could hear the next room's door bell, but otherwise a restful stay Gym is 24hrs - so if you're jet lagged - get your running shoes on and burn off a few. The pool is not 24hrs... 6am-10pm (still pretty respectable) Service - unobtrusive and friendly. I'd stay here again

title: Great place and location
desc: I stayed here during biz trip 27-30 apr ago. The room was spacious, nice, and clean. It only 400m from Tanjong Pagar MRT station so its accessible to everywhere if you dont want to take taxi. Convenient store are across the street. Would stayed here again for another SG visit

title: Amazing stay during first Singapore trip
desc: My partner and I chose this hotel for a four-night stay based on its location, modern, spacious styling, gym and club floor/lounge amenities for our very first trip to Singapore. We had just left Japan, generally known for its excellent service levels (but minuscule hotel rooms), and weren't sure what to expect in the next country. The Carlton City did not disappoint. The hotel itself was easily accessed from the MTR - a short walk from the Tanjong Pagar station after getting on the train at the airport. Our flight was late, and we approached the desk in the late evening (at about 8pm). Lea and the front desk staff were very polite and helpful. There was a slight hitch checking in; some guests had left later than expected due to a very late checkout (more delayed flights),

title: Regular Guest
desc: This hotel is extremely well located. It is within a short walking distance to the MRT at Tanjong Pagar and is within reasonable walking distance to the Singapore Bay area and Chinatown. The facilities in the hotel arte absolutely first class. The rooms are well appointed and maintained and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel also has a great outdoor pool and a small indoor gym. The hotel has two bars, both of which are an excellent way to unwind, after a busy day. Highly recommended.

title: Spotless and central
desc: We were thrilled with this lovely hotel, we stayed two nights and enjoyed the entire experience. The rooms are large, clean and modern and the Club Room was beautiful with sweeping city and bay views.

title: Pleasant Stay.
desc: I stayed at the Carlton City hotel for 2 nights on business and found the service and hotel to be of a high standard. The room was of a clean, well appointed and of a good size. The buffet breakfast had everything you needed and was of a high quality. I would certainly stay there the next time I visit Singapore on business.

title: Punt rewarded - Pleasantly surprised
desc: It is hard choosing a hotel from the internet in a city with lots to choose from and little guidance to help select. Price and location were important to me and given i was in day 7 of a hurried trip from Australia to Canada to London to Milan and then Singapore I craved a little bit of luxury. After looking for a while, I took a punt and chose Carlton City Hotel and can esaily say the room is the best one I've had in a while, which includes a large suite in Piccadilly, London.

title: Standards are slipping
desc: This is my regular choice for hotel and in the past have been extremely happy with cleanliness of rooms, staff and service. Lately, last 6 months it's been slipping. Things don't work in rooms, housekeeping does not replace laundry bags and staff seem indifferent to customer service.

title: Great hotel.
desc: + Really helpful and friendly staff. All possible was done to satisfy customer. + Clean, well managed hotel premises. + Location near Chinatown and MRT + Breakfast - Gym quite small and quite often water and towels ran out from gym. Staff and service was unforgettable. Always smiling, always giving their best hints to make Singapore vacation successful. We got room upgrade, late check out and possibility to come back for shower before night flight just because their goodwill.

title: Comfortable and ok for the promotion price
desc: We stayed Carlton City Hotel for 3 nights. We were in Singapore for the first time, and wanted to have a good location. For that Chinatown and also this hotel serves well, at least, if you want to visit the hip bars nearby and enjoy the food. Also walking distance to e.g. Marina Bay Sands (if on holiday mode). We stayed in a club room on the 24th floor with harbor view. Room was tidy, comfortable and quite spacious. Club lounge offered a nice breakfast and cocktail hour with nice view terrace. However, service (e.g. wine or snacks) outside these times were very limited, which was slightly disappointing, since on holiday, we love to have a glass or two when coming from our daily tours, whatever the hour. Also the complimentary minibar with refill everyday was very limited in the

title: Very good location for foodies
desc: The location of the hotel, near Chinatown, it is very good. Near to the famous Maxwell Food Court, a smaller food court and market, 7 minutes walk to the Michelin Star street food place and very close to a metro station. Nice swimming pool.

title: lived up to it's star rating
desc: From the front desk staff to the concierge, etc, everyone was warm and friendly but efficient and helpful. The rooms had floor to ceiling windows and were bigger than usual. So it really was very restful. It was another part of Singapore that we hadn't explored before. It may not be a shopping area but it had other things close to it that is typically Singapore. So that was enjoyable - exploring nearby markets, China town. Would not mind staying here again.

title: Very Accomodating
desc: We flew in on a red eye to Singapore and tried our luck to check in early (7am). The staff were very accommodating and arranged a room for us within three hours. The rooms are large and very tidy. The hotel is very new (or feels it at least) so has some nice luxuries (nice lobby, swimming pool, gym, common facilities etc) Best part about this hotel is the price, you get a lot of bang for your buck, but also how close it is to the Tanjong Pagar MRT station and newly developed Duxton Road (both about 2 mins walk away). In short; Definitely stay again whether it be for holiday, in transit or on business etc.

title: Great location for Chinatown
desc: Very friendly and efficient staff; great room; very clean; super bed quality; great shower; fast wifi and we really appreciated the use of a shower room the evening after check out as we had a late night flight

title: Carlton City on April 2017 (3rd Re-visit for Weekend Break)
desc: VERY BAD Front Desk by the name 'William' refused to serve us at all cost for 2 days when we approached. Another Front Desk by the name 'Ariff' served us, however, even for this 3rd visit to the hotel, we're shocked that he actually asked unprofessional questions in a nasty tone. Over the past 2-3 years, there're no improvement or changes made. The receptionists are tired, not motivated, arrogant and slow in service. Manager please. They need your training and observation frequently. Room although well upkeep, we noticed a big spider hanging around the desk lamp at night which scares us. Later, we noticed there's lots of spider web build around desk lamp. Housekeepers maybe you want to dust down all room corners, behind the curtains and possible places of habitat for the

title: Location location location
desc: If I could rate this hotel on location it would be 5 stars. That said, I wish I could say the same for the service. Checking in took about 30 minutes - I'm not quite sure why. To anyone traveling with an infant you'll understand that 30 minutes feels like hours. I had booked two rooms for my family and had to give my credit card for 3 separate transactions for incidentals. Just felt extremely inefficient, especially for Singapore. Secondly, the rooms are only made up every other day. I totally understand hotels going green and not doing laundry unless specified by putting towels in bathtub or floor, but it would have been nice to have minimally our bed made and a change of trash bins. We left the "make up" room sign on for a good 4 hours and no one came. The few small upsides to

title: One of the best!
desc: Loved this hotel! It wasn't the cheapest but reasonable value for Singapore & good location for Chinatown & plenty of bars & restaurants. The room was spacious, very modern & the air con was great. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and particularly the concierge were always keen to check everyone was to our liking. When we did have a problem, it was resolved immediately. The breakfast was varied & good quality for the price when compared to options outside the hotel. The inclusion of the handy phone is also a great perk, allowing data use & calls for free. The only suggestion for the handy phone is that it would have been good if the Uber app was installed as standard as we found Uber much cheaper than local taxis. Would definitely stay here again!

title: great place to stay
desc: We had a great time, staff is friendly and helpfull, rooms are nice, they even provide you with a mobile phone for your stay. Nice location, close to chinatown and quick ride by taxi to all the other places to see. Nice rooftop bar for a drink during happy hour

title: Exceeded all expectations
desc: Everything from start to finish was exceptional. Very accommodating and friendly staff and comfy, well decorated rooms. The hotel is situated on the fringe of downtown and only a few minutes walk to Tanjong Pagar MRT. Also like everywhere else in Singapore, the hotel is spotlessly clean. The famous Maxwell Food Centre is also a 5 minute walk away. I will definitely stay again next time I am in Singapore. 5 stars from me.

title: Great location.
desc: Having had a stop over at Singapore for a couple of days during our honeymoon we chose to stay at Carlton city hotel. The location is great, only a couple of mins walk away from China town. We don't have much to complain about since all our needs were met, late checkout, extra pillows etc the only reason I've given it 4 starts is because my husband didn't find the bed very comfortable and would have preferred more breakfast options. I on the other hand slept blissfully!

title: Perfect location - just the room is a bit damp
desc: The location is perfect - right in the heart of Tanjong Pagar. The staff and facilities are great, the only downfall is that our room was very damp. I think something wrong with the air conditioning so not sure if it is in every room, but definitely raise it if you feel the room is a bit too moist. We weren't too sure and then we left, we realised all our paper was very damp :( The room itself is spacious enough and you can get an interesting view, but the best thing about the place is the location.

title: Carlton City Hotel
desc: What a place, if you want to be treated like royalty book in here. From the time you arrive, to the time you leave, feel pampered. Excellent breakfast with an amazing choice for all tastes. Want to explore the city? Tanjong Pagar MRT is on your doorstop. On the other hand, buy a hop on hop off from Duck and Hippo, their open top bus stops even closer to the hotel- the brown line.

title: Impeccable
desc: When in Singapore, I'd always feel the city ticks like clockwork. This hotel is no different. I was hard pressed to find fault anywhere. Room size was generous (as was the bathroom - real plus point!), cleanliness was unblemished, and everything functioned as it should. (Oh, the TV remote went missing one afternoon, but it was an honest mistake by housekeeping while wrapping away the sheets) And the best surprise of all, considering Singapore's intolerance to cigarettes, we managed to get a smoking room! (Good on you chaps!) Location was fantastic, with most places we visited being no more than 10 minutes by uber. Ambiance was serene, even though we were smack in the centre of this city state. Overall, an unimpeachable stay.

title: Amazing hotel, brilliant Staff, want to go back.
desc: What can I say about this wonderful hotel. Let me start with the Staff, they are wonderful, kind, helpful and I almost felt like I was leaving friends behind by the time we left (4 days I was here). They greeted us and and by the end knew our names and what we were doing for the day. They informed us of places to go and when to go and couldn't have been more helpful. The staff are a credit to this hotel. I would like to name Jenny the bar staff as one of the many to stand out and Jerimiah the bell boy who couldn't have been more helpful, you are wonderful. Also the reception team who helped show us places to go. The rooms were spotless so we'll done to the housekeeping services. We were close to all areas and for $10 to $15 you could get a taxi to the downtown area. I couldn't

title: Room for improvement in service standards
desc: Checked into this hotel for our celebration of our anniversary. The check-in process was rather smooth, we were allocated our room on the 8th floor in about ten minutes. The room was quiet and clean, no stains in the bathroom and the bed was really comfortable. You can find food in the surrounding area anytime in the day, and there is a 24-hour supermarket just across the road. However, for those who are looking for free upgrades or something of that sort for your special occasions during off-peak season, you need to look elsewhere. Nope, we didn't receive any greetings or well-wishes for our occasion here unlike our experience at other similar hotels. The service we received from most of the hotel staff were also lukewarm, there were very little smiles and friendly greetings. I

title: Great Location and nearby Maxwell Food Center!!
desc: Visit as a family trip with a kid. Very nearby Tanjong Pargar MRT Station. Close to Maxwell Food Center if you wanna try Singapore famous Chicken Rice, only 5 mins. walk from the hotel. Opposite to fairprize, market and 7-11. 100AM shopping mall is next to the hotel and there're a lot of Japanese Restaurant. Around 10 mins for walk to Chinatown. 2 - 3 station to Marina Bay, Merlion Park. Staff provided a good service and the room is perfect. All important amenities are provided. Free Handy Phone is really good, free call to my country and free internet included. Free wifi in the room is good signal. This is a first choice for me for my next trip to Singapore.

title: Great
desc: We had one night in Singapore and I know I can't really review with the full picture. Nevertheless, the time spent here was very comfortable and it was conveniently located near a MRT station. The property itself was very clean and I felt the efficiency from the staff members and that is all I look into a business for a great service.

title: Great hotel, close to the Chinatown market
desc: The Carton City hotel is a great place to stay, located in Chinatown - it's only 15 minute walk to the Chinatown Markets so you can grab your souvenirs and head to the famed Liao Fan Hong Kong Soy Sauce Chicken Rice and Noodle! The room we stayed in was a generous size as well as the king size bed and the air conditioning was a welcome reprieve from the humidity outside. Having time to stop for a quick splash in the pool on the 3rd floor was also nice. The only thing I found odd was the window between the bedroom and bathroom and that there was no hand wash or soap in the bathroom provided. All in all, I'd happily stay here again

title: NOT GOOD
desc: After arriving from an excellent hotel in Hong Kong, we looked forward to enjoying our stay here. What a disaster. Basically the hotel is for Corporate Business and not Tourists. The outdoor pool was pleasant enough but the sunbeds had bird droppings on them and empty glasses on the ground and many leaves around the pool. Why for the sake of 5 minutes every so often someone could not clean the surroundings. The housekeeping was terrible and on the second day had to speak to the Duty Manager regarding the cleaning of the bathroom as no one had bothered to clean the bath. The breakfast well the worst I have ever had in a hotel. When I asked for 2 sunny side up fried eggs I was told to take the ones off the plate under the Hot Lamp. These eggs are cooked in an oven and then

title: Rude staff
desc: I have been travel so many country and city and have met with many wonderful hotel staff who enjoyed at their job. But with this hotel the first impression was I am under paid and I am better than this. The management should really relook their front desk staff.....the next day the laundry staff knocking at my door at 8:30 am and because we came in late I have decided to sleep in but she continue to knock until I open the door and told I don't have laundry. What kind of training does she have? If you knock 4 times and the door is not open then you should stop knocking and move on.... anyway, I have told my staff to never book this hotel again not even for free......

title: Great location, amazingly good service
desc: WeÂ´ve just stayed for a couple of days at Carlton City and we totally enjoyed it! The room was very spacious and modern with a great view. Since we loved to have a special privilege, weÂ´ve decided to book the "Club Lounge" in addition to the room. And what to say: Shek and the whole team of the Club Lounge provided an excellent service! Always on point and always caring in a warm and humble kindness. Unfortunately weÂ´ve missed to announce in advance, that we would like to have some vegetarian food but this was after all no issue and immediately something was prepared for us. Also, when having questions what to do in Singapore, and where you should go to to have lunch or dinner, Shek and the whole team gave you the answers right away at any time. Thank you so much for the great

title: Lovely property, good location and great service
desc: Fantastic hotel, clean, spacious rooms. Go for a club upgrade if you can, totally worth the extra â‚¬â‚¬â‚¬. Easily accesible by MTR and within walking distance from all tourist attractions. We will be back!

title: Perfect place to stay
desc: Love the place. Close to China town and its attractions, a slow walk to Singapore river, clarky. In the night the nearby surroundings come alive with lots of out door eating places. The train station is right next door to the hotel and it is convenient to go around the city with minimal fuss. Loved the place.

title: Had a great holiday!
desc: Loved staying at this hotel, the room was very comfortable and the service was very friendly and efficient. The pool area is fantastic and the restaurant has excellent food, I highly recommend their buffet as its great value for such delicious food. We had a very late flight home so I really appreciated that they allowed us to store our luggage after we checked out and freshen up later in the day in a spare room at the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: a very comfortable stay!!
desc: The location is very good, 3 min walk to Tanjong Pagar MRT station, and there are 3 supermarkets nearby (one is of 24hr), one convenient store, one food center. The room is clean and with modern style. The bathroom has a window that you can have a relaxing bath in the big size bath tub watching TV. Staffs are friendly. Will choose this hotel for next travel!

title: Great Singapore Hotel
desc: A modern hotel located conveniently 3 minutes walk to an MRT train station. From the moment of arrival to departure staff showed a genuine warmth and sense of welcome...excellent in answering questions and providing a real feeling they enjoyed their jobs. The room was spacious and well accessorised. The foyer was large and attractively decorated with comfortable lounge areas while awaiting pick-up for tours etc. The advice not to book a shuttle to the airport and that a taxi would be more economical (there were 3 of us) was "spot on"...shuttle from airport to hotel was s$27 for three, taxi hotel to airport was s$24 - and much faster. We could not fault our stay in this hotel and congratulate management and staff on the way they treat their guests.

title: Facility in the room is horrible
desc: The facility in the room needs to be improved, the air-conditioned is not possible to adjust the temperature nor turn off. I have to bear it. The hair dryer is not function properly and it's not first time that it happened to me. It's very old one. To shower i have to be patience cause this is the green hotel, water runs very slow then i am almost become green liked the hotel concept. The hotel staff are friendly especially bellboy on jun07 who worked morning shift (10am.) Unfortunately I didn't know his name. Hope the management will improve and make things get better.

title: Great staff, nice rooms, good location
desc: The staff are what make this hotel a place I would keep going back to -- they could not be kinder, friendlier or more helpful. Hats off to the staff and management! For the rest, the rooms have crisp, modern decor and are well-maintained with nice city views; the breakfast buffet is plentiful and varied, if not extravagant, and is set in a pleasant, light-filled room. Tanjong Pagar is a great location for restaurants, bars and city-wandering. If you are on a club floor, the club and outdoor terrace is a good place to sit and socialize or work. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Holiday with fam
desc: Good hotel, helpful staff, well positioned. China town and many eats nearby. In house restaurant also had good food. 24hr convenience store across the road from hotel. It was a wonderful stay for the week we were there.

title: Great location
desc: We stayed here for 4 nights . Great location, clean hotel, very close to China town and MRT Tanjong pagar. Helpful staff at the reception and concierge . Jermaiya, is always willing to guide and get hold of a taxi in moments time. Nazer was very helpful in fixing the punctured tyre of our pram ( there were no shops nearby and we had to catch flight next day ). Rooms are spacious and clean. The downside is the breakfast. It lacks variety and quality (not worth the price). That's the reason for 4 stars.

title: Amazing hotel.
desc: Myself and my partner stayed here for 3 nights. Upon arrival we asked if they had a smoking room available. They didn't that first night but told us to pack our luggage and they would move our luggage for the second 2 nights while we explored. Clean room with all the little extras making it even more special. Lovely staff. We will stay here next time we come to Singapore.

title: Absolutely Wonderful Stay 10/10
desc: The Carlton City Hotel (Gopeng St, as there are two) is wonderful. Rooms are beautiful and very well maintained. Internal restaurants are fantastic. Location is superb, only a few dollars almost anywhere in a cab from here or the MRT is just a block away. Room comes with a smart phone, free international calls, free data & perfect for getting you around the city, they're full of great ideas, places to see, discount tickets and so much more. Well not even bother checking out other hotels when we return, Carlton City has looked after us so very well and the staff are second to none. 10/10 from us on every aspect from price to the smart phone. Treat yourself, you deserve it.

title: Perfect location
desc: This hotel was literally a 3 min walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT which is on the same line as the airport. The location of this hotel is great, we were able to locate eateries within 1 min walking. Hawker centre opposite the hotel can provide you with cheap but authentic singaporean breakfast. The supermarket opposite can provide you with your souvenir needs as well as a laundromat located in the plaza to wash your clothes (fraction of the price of hotel laundry service). The rooms were a good size and the room was very clean. We didn't really interact with the hotel staff as much as we hoped to compared with other hotels. Only check in and check out. However, they are very professional. Overall, I would stay here again if I ever do visit Singapore due to its location as well as

title: Great hotel
desc: Excellently located, this modern and comfortable hotel offers everything a tourist might look for. Spacious rooms, excellent A/C, clean and well maintained rooms, new, soft towels.. Friendly staff . Abundant breakfast, catering for all tastes.Really rewarding!

title: Great location , with great rooms
desc: The room and bed are very comfortable. We asked for baby cot in the booking and they had it in the room when we checked in. Great location, 2 minutes walk to the MRT station and lots of food nearby - and its easy to grab taxi from the lobby too.

title: Excellent Hotel
desc: Things are just perfect here. The hotel is near the financial district, has good rooms, good restaurants and all other amenities. You can go around the city easily from this place. Specially for the business travelers, this would be a good hotel to check in.

title: Best stay in Singapore
desc: I stayed at the Carlton City Hotel for 5 nights for business and had a wonderful stay from start to finish. My check in after a long flight from the UK was fast and my welcome at the check-in desk was super friendly! I didn't have breakfast included in my room, so each morning I would get a bagel or croissant from the handy cafe by the reception area. The room was clean, quiet and the bed was super comfy. I had great sleeps during my stay. Just make sure you switch on do not disturb on your room - or someone will try to clean your room very early (made this mistake one morning)! The location is excellent - short walks to many nice restaurants and into the city (if it's not too hot). I will definitely stay here again if I return to Singapore!

title: Excellent Singapore Option
desc: I could not fault this hotel. Good sized room with city views. Clean and contemporary and excellent service. The breakfast buffet was outstanding both in terms of the variety of offerings and the quality of food. The location at the southern end of Chinatown is a little away from the action but there is a metro station nearby and I enjoyed the 20 minute walk.

title: a good standard chain hotel
desc: situated not far from attractions. rooms are comfortable, nothing special. clean. good service, fine buffet breakfast. we were situated on a high floor (30) so there was a beautiful view.good value for money.

title: Great location for holiday and business
desc: 1. Location: one of the most important piece of travel is the location of the hotel, specially if it's your first time in the city. The location of Carlton City Hotel Singapore is very convenient, for both holiday and business. It's very close to MRT (train station) and Singapore trains are very well connected. Has some good hawkers food markets at walking distance (Maxwell and Amoy Street Food Centre). There is a grocery store right across the street and a lot of good restaurants around the area. Also one can walk to the business district. In Singapore nothing is too far any ways. Rooms: rooms are spacious and most should come with some view. We were on 23rd floor and had a good view of docks. The bathroom had a tub and a shower with sufficient toiletries. Comfy bed, big

title: High tech system
desc: Conducted a training session here and the meeting room had a high tech LCD projection system, that unfortunately couldn't connect to my laptop and iPad. The tech person was efficient enough to revert to old tech cable to configure my system and the meeting went smoothly. Coffee and tea were available throughout the meeting.

title: Definitely recommended!!
desc: I've stayed in Singapore many times for work and have tried many of the hotels in Singapore from the Mandarin Oriental to the Ritz Carlton Millenia. For a price-value, I can't think of any that does it better than Carlton City Hotel. The staff are amazing - especially the concierge!! Always ready to give some helpful tip or make a booking for you. Everything is easily accessible - Clarke Quay being a 10 minute taxi ride away; and China Town a short walk from the hotel.

title: Good location, but don't eat beakfast there
desc: We stayed at this hotel for four days, and I must sadly comit it did not fulfill our expectations. We had insects in our bathroom, which we informed the staff about twice. Even tough nothing was done to remove them. We did not order breakfast for the whole stay, but we ate at the hotel one morning. I am glad we did not have to eat there again. The area was noicy and the food was not of the best quality. The orange juice tasted fake and the scrambled eggs as well. In lack of places we had to sit right next to some chinese guests with bad manners (in european standards), which made the experience even worse. The next morning we had breakfast in the area around the hotel, which was much more satisfying. The positive thing about this hotel was the location, modern facilities and

title: Excellent Hotel & Facilities
desc: This was my first visit to Singapore and was placed at Carlton city hotel, a very unique facility which I got to experience is a complementary mobile phone at your service in your room with absolutely free local and international (specific countries) calling with unlimited data services on it. No doubt all other facilities are also equally good. Ranjit

title: Not reaching its full potential
desc: Well located.Nice lobby with a very efficient staff at the reception. Also the room looks and is indeed very nicely decorated and equipped. I struggled in switching off all lights, too digitalized. At the end I had no other alternative than to take out the central power card at the entry. Having left rather late the room the afternoon team forgot to clean the room for my second night.The organization (seating) at breakfast on the 3rd floor is rather chaotic.So you cannot really enjoy the good food.

title: Great Place for weekend
desc: We Stayed 2 night and room was nice and clean. Good swimming pool on 2nd floor. Supermarket across from hotel which is open 24 hours. Safe neighborhood. All in all a great place to stay. We would not hesitate to stay there again and would recommend Carlton city hotel to any traveller.

title: Well organised and pleasant
desc: We stayed for one night and everything worked the way it was supposed to. Excellent service and not too far away from the action. The foyer has a bar and small restaurant which looked OK. Over the road is a pavement bar and around the corner more bars and restaurants. We had a few requests which were handled efficiently and with a smile from the staff. The room was comfortable and clean albeit a little small. The roof top bar was OK but not cheap. Typical modern city hotel. We would stay again.

title: â€œFirst Classâ€
desc: This place is superb.The room and bathrooms are clean. The food is great too.And the best thing i like the most is the service,the people in this place are always available and happy to assist you. On top of that,the supervisor on duty, Lea, was very attentive and very accomodating. Thumbs up to the team there. We enjoyed a relaxing stay at Carlton City Hotel. Kudos Lea and Team!!

title: Very impressive
desc: First time staying here and very impressed. Nice new hotel, check in was slick and room was very impressive, comfortable and large. Location is a little out of the way of things for me but closeish to the MRT and still easy to get around and also only 20 mins from the airport. Lots of places to eat nearby which was great. A good option if staying for business.

title: Small flies
desc: This hotel is new and maintained quite well. The staffs there are also very friendly. What i dont like about this hotel is the toilet. More than 10 small flies. Have to ask the staffs to come and spray some pesticides in early morning. Very disgusting.

title: Very Impressed
desc: My partner and I have stayed in a number of different hotels in Singapore over the years and we were extremely impressed with the Carlton City Hotel. All the staff were extremely nice and helpful. Our room was lovely and very clean. We found it in a great location to then go out and explore as we do like to go walking, although probably not next to any major attractions it was still in a good area. I would probably say it is my favourite Singapore Hotel that we have stayed in. Definitely would highly recommend it.

title: Very comfortable hotel
desc: I have stayed in this hotel for one night. Very modern, luxury and comfortable hotel at affordable price. Rooms are spacious. Good location. Very good connection to MRT. The view is not great, so make sure you get a room on higher floor facing China town.

title: Great Central Hotel
desc: Could not fault anything with this hotel. The service was very good and the breakfast had a good range of food.The MRT station was a 5 minute walk away. The concierge service was very good and we were able to store our bags prior to catching a late flight.

title: Good base for working from
desc: Stayed 3 nights, and have been here a few times before. Hotel is in a good location, but not next to any major sight seeing opportunities. Staff friendly and welcoming, especially Gilbert. Nice views from roof top bar, although it poured with rain one night it was stil,useable. Rooms clean and well kept, glass wall to bath a little strange, but they do provide a blind and you can lie in the bath and watch tv just not hear it! There was a stray hair in the bath, but that does happen sometimes, it must have just been missed. Breakfast is a quick in and out affair and the same every day. Cook to order omelettes are good. Not a hotel with a main restaurant, which is odd for this size of hotel, but loads of places to eat out nearby in this vibrant city. For food in, go to the

title: Very disappointed
desc: The interior is nice and you would have high expectations after the first impression. But 3 things made me very angry and disappointed: - on 2 of 7 nights I didn't receive shampoo and shower gel - at breakfast you'll be seated at a table with other single strangers because of the small dining room (hard to imagine for a hotel that big) - the iron didn't work - the most annoying thing: you order room service, they promise to bring the food in 30 minutes. Alter 1 hour: still nothing! Wow...I had to cancel the order because I had to work the next day...cant wait all night, right? Need some sleep, too. All in all Not recommendible die this price!

title: Lovely hotel with helpful staff.
desc: We have stayed at a number of hotels in Singapore over the years and this is my favourite hotel so far and one I will come back to. The rooms are an adequate size with super comfortable beds. The hotel breakfast was brilliant with a large selection of foods ranging from continental, to local, to your typical 'English style' breakfast. We found the hotel well situated- it is near the MRT and a taxi ride from the hotel to the marina/bay area will cost around $8-$10. The hotel is within walking distance of the Maxwell food court which has the food stall 'Tian Tian' that is famous for its chicken rice- and it doesn't disappoint! The hotel staff are very efficient and helpful- we arrived early after a night flight and the staff happily accommodated an early check in (by a good few

title: Great Hotel
desc: The hotel room we had was on the 22nd floor. The room was very clean and spacious, with everything you need for a few nights stay. They even had a mobile phone that you could use while you stayed there with a lot of helpful apps on. We would differently stay here again. The staff where very friendly and helpful.

title: Exceptional porter
desc: Best location to travel within Singapore. We love how good the lobby smells and of course the abundant space of the room. The service provided by the porter boy is great as he makes conversations and keeps us entertained while we wait for our ride. Enjoyable service rendered and made us feel very much at home.

title: Very disappointed
desc: The attitude of staff (a manager and a staff from room department) is not friendly when I was requesting to send my lost and found stuff to Carlton hotel, another hotel in the same hotel chain and same city. Even this service is not provided, the attitude can be better. But the manager told me he wants me to pay s$ 30 for taxi. Actually, the normal taxi fee is around s$7 per trip and only 3 MRT stations away. I stayed 10 nights in carlton city and another 4 days in carlton. I feel the service is really bad.

title: Convenient location
desc: It is only 2 min walk to the Tanjong Pagar MRT station which is two stops away from City Hall (the popular shopping area). Hotel staff were all very nice and provided speedy service when we asked for some paper. The overall rating cannot be excellent because: 1. The room was basically clean but with some stains on the toilet floor and wall near the window. The towels also looked not clean enough (not sure it is because of the quality of the towels). When we checked in, the area around the basin in the toilet was not clean 2. Only 2 packets of tea bags were provided

title: First time in Singapore
desc: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days at beginning of our holiday and 3 days after returning from Malaysia. Rooms a large and beds are so comfortable, also room very clean,although on second visit shower room door didn't close properly. Staff, especially concierge staff are very helpful. They cannot do enough, without being too "pushy" !! Haslam( ??) was particularly helpful and pointed us in the direction of some lovely areas to eat. For a fist time stay in Singapore this was a great hotel to stay in and we would definitely go back again. Breakfast was also very good with so much choice and excellent service.

title: Good location
desc: There are lots of restaurants around the hotel with a few shopping Malls. Local food court & groceries market are just across the street. Chinatown is 10 minutes stroll away. There are bus or MRT stations within 5 Min walk. We got a very city view from our room. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room is quite spacious with nice decor and very clean. They also have good quality toiletries.

title: Reasonable stay
desc: A small business hotel - nice modern rooms, average breakfast, small lobby but quietly efficient and well located. Good for a short business stay. Some distance from Orchard street etc but otherwise okay

title: Value for money and good location
desc: Arrived and was warmly welcomed by front desk. Normal checkin procedure, nothing special. Nice room and bathroom with open scene to rest of room and view. Breakfast average nothing special. Stay 2-4 Sep during business trip.

title: Very comfortable and family friendly
desc: Location is excellent, close to MRT station and convenient stores.Plenty of eateries especially Chinese and Korean Restaurants.Hotel is well maintained, facilities are top and staff are friendly.I would like to highlight the hospitality and warmth showered by Shaari, Front Office Manager and his team.

title: Exceptional Service
desc: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Carlton City Hotel. The highlight for us was the wonderful service that we received. The staff went above and beyond to make sure that we were comfortable. In terms of the room it was modern and very clean. We had a wonderful view overlooking the port. Regarding the location there were plenty of food options within walking distance. Also, we were well connected to the attractions that we wanted to visit. Across the road was a small supermarket which we found very handy.

title: Really amazing hotel!
desc: The check in didn't go well because of a miscommunication between the hotel and Hotels.com But everything else have been really great! The service is in top, the staff is really nice, the hotel looks new. The beds are good. The rooftopbar is great. The pool area is OK, it will be all sunny in around 1. We enjoyed our stay - thank you!

title: Great
desc: We stayed for 6 nights for the Singapore GP. It is a bit faraway from the track so if you want peace it is great, if you want to be close to the "GP action" (track/restaurants/bars and parties) not so much. Staff is great and we appreciated the early check-in after a 10 hour flight. If you do not like big fluffy pillows bring your, as they do not have slim ones I felt the swimming pool was more suited to a business traveller than a leisure one.

title: A great hotel in a fun neighborhood
desc: We enjoyed our stay, the bell staff particularly were fun and welcoming. The hotel is sleek and modern and very clean. We didn't have a chance to have a cocktail on the rooftop but the view was spectacular and we will definitely do that next time. It's an easy walk to really good restaurants and neighborhoods with old style colonial shophouses contrasted by soaring modern architecture. Chinatown is fun, and walkable, too. My only complaint were the pillows were too firm without softer options in the closet. I forgot to ask housekeeping to switch them out so it is possible that they do offer options.

title: Modern and value for money....
desc: Stayed her recently on a business trip to SP. Hotel is modern, staff friendly and fast. Rooms modern, well appointed, very clean and beds are comfortable. Whilst not in the middle of the downtown precinct, it's only a 15 min walk . 5 min taxi ride and from a value for money perspective, well worth checking out. Plenty of shops, restaurants and convenience stores around to cover all needs. Breakfast was included I my room package so can't comment on price. Food was typical hotel buffet style fare. Passable, filled a hole but not destination dinning.

title: Great hotel good location
desc: This is a first class hotel. The location is good for getting into the main tourist areas and attractions. The rooms are well equipped and the view from our floor 26 amazing. Food was excellent and the staff friendly and helpful.

title: Always has been my first choice whenever I visit Singapore
desc: I have always been staying at this hotel whenever I visit Singapore. The location is very strategic and very close to the MRT station (Tanjong Pagar), walking distance to some nice cool cafes, or local food court. It has got a rooftop bar where you can chill and hangout in the afternoon.

title: Great hotel
desc: Great business hotel. Good gym and pool and decent size room. The breakfast buffet is very good. Only a 10 or so minute walk to club street where you will find great bars and restaurants. If working in the financial district it is only about 10min from there too.

title: Nice Stay..
desc: Used to stay at Oasis but this time tried Carlton for a change. Surprisingly, the room is much larger, food is much better and the staff are more friendly. Now that I tried Carlton City, never again will I go back to Oasis and having tried a few other hotels, this is definitely the one to stay in from now on when in Singapore.

title: Visit for F1, Wonderful Hotel
desc: Stay here from part of the package for F1 Singapore which include air ticket, F1 admission, hotel. Paid at quite good deal, not to expect too much on hotel accommodations even though my travel agent told me. No idea how old of this hotel, but looks new and renovation still trendy. Receptions, Concierge even Bakery people are nice and friendly. Room is good and clean with enough amenities. Housekeeping is quick enough after you hung up. Downside is the breakfast with not much choices and fair taste, fine with me to stuff my empty stomach in the morning though. Good hotel to stay with.

title: Excellent service and cleanliness
desc: I have stayed twice in the Carlton City and can rate the staff very highly for attentiveness, helpfulness and efficiency. The rooms are clean and well-equipped. The wifi was strong and included in the room rate. Lifts are extremely quick. The food could use a bit more flavour. The pool is great for laps!

title: Excellent value and customer service
desc: I just spent a night there as a stopover, and the service from all staff, but in particular the concierge and porters couldn't be faulted. The room was modern and spacious and provides excellent value for the room price paid.

title: Excellent modern hotel in Chinatown
desc: This is an modern well run hotel in an excellent location in the historic Chinatown area of the city. The rooms are roomy, very clean with comfortable beds and good shower. The staff are friendly and helpful. Ask for the higher floors and a north facing view out over the city.

title: Very comfortable, clean and quiet hotel in an excellent location
desc: A friend and I paid extra to take advantage of the Club benefits, which included 2 items of laundry per day, evening drinks (including cocktails) and hors d'oeuvres (enough for a light dinner) in the Club Lounge, and complimentary soft drinks, chips and nuts from the minibar in our room, as well as a fabulous view. The king single beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom included a deep bath. The rooms are quiet and everything was very clean. The location is excellent, in the historic Tanjong Pagar district, which is now full of Japanese and Korean bars and restaurants. It is opposite a local supermarket and market, including food stalls, and ATMs. It is a 10 minute walk to the Maxwell Food Centre (hawker food) and 15 minutes to the heart of China Town. It is about a 1

title: Perfect location for a business trip
desc: This hotel has the perfect location - Right opposite the Tanjong Pagar MRT station and walking distance to the business district. Lots of eateries around Tanjong Pagar area and MRT station. The room is spacious with modern design, very comfortable bed. Simple buffet breakfast, not much variety. This hotel is perfect for business travellers, who just want to come back to a nice hotel room to relax and have a nice dinner nearby (lots of nice cafes within walking distance) but not so much for those who likes shopping as there is not much to shop around here. Overall, it's a place I will certainly come back to. Love the pleasant neighbourhood.

title: Excellent hotel with a few improvement needed.
desc: Stayed for two nights the first week of October at room 2302.I found the room was great. The king sized bed especially was very comfy with 4 pillows and two more red pillows for the couch. The bedroom and the bathroom are separated with a glass window with a curtain. The room was equipped with a small fridge for beverages, a safe, two complimentary bottled water, a free to use mobile phone for local & international calls. The mobile phone was a welcome additional feature I've never seen before at other hotels I've stayed at. The bathroom didn't have a bathtub. During my last night there, there were some many small flies appeared in the shower room. I wasn't bothered by it but it's something the management want to check closely. The wifi speed was quite fast at around 5 Mbps. The

title: Return Visit - still great!
desc: This time round I stayed for a week in a club room, which adds following benefits: - Club Lounge on 28th floor for breakfast (no queues and great service) - Complimentary mini bar - Some items of laundry included Overall, a great stay, once again. In summary: will return! Other comments: - Great location (close to Tanjong Pagar SMRT station) - Reasonable rates (if booked well in advance!) - Great facilities, generous room size - Clean and in great condition

title: Excellent service
desc: We booked the Carlton City through Tingo (a TripAdvisor company) for our family of 4. The booking site showed the Deluxe Room as having a maximum occupancy of 4, so that's what we booked. Upon arrival we discovered that the room could only accommodate 3, and only then by using virtually all of the floor space by slotting in an extra single bed next to the usual king. The hotel, however, responded to this very well. It was not their fault at all but they offered to upgrade us to a suite with a much reduced price. This was a two room suite with enough space for two extra single beds in the living room. While a little cosy with the living room furniture, it worked well. The hotel also waived the usual "extra bed" charges and gave all 4 of us access to the Club Lounge for free,

title: Clean, Modern Hotel
desc: Stayed here for 6 nights with family. Really nice clean, modern hotel. All the amenities you could need, including a nice pool and small gym. Buffet breakfast had a really good selection, however the coffee machine needs to be upgraded as itâ€™s of very poor quality. Staff were a mixed bag with some very friendly and helpful and others not so much. When asking for a late checkout, instead of a friendly no thank i was given attitude, as if it was such an inconvenience to ask. The rooms are great but if youâ€™re looking to stay with children it wonâ€™t be very comfortable. They cram a single bed in a double room and itâ€™s very very cramped. Overall a good stay but canâ€™t give it more than three stars as there is plenty of room for improvement considering the rate they charge

title: Nice hotel in an excellent location
desc: Very clean, friendly, well run hotel in a prime location of Singapore. Rooms are spacious, quiet, clean, good shape. Room was on the 21st floor with excellent views of Singapore. Location of the Carlton is convenient to transportation, restaurants, bars, shopping.

title: Quiet, Good Location, Lovely Club
desc: Tagged along with my husband on a business trip. We were fortunate to have a club room.
